Python Code python
import os import requests import json import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus from bs4 import BeautifulSoup print('=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH ===') print('Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor') print('Time Period: 1900-1910') print('Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)') print('Objective: Find exact death date from obituaries and death records\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) # Define targeted search queries for James Smith Jr.'s death information search_queries = [ 'James Smith Jr. New Jersey death obituary', 'James Smith Jr. Essex County prosecutor died', 'James Smith Jr. Newark attorney death date', 'James Smith Jr. obituary New Jersey 1900-1910', 'James Smith Jr. death records Essex County NJ', 'James Smith Jr. Newark lawyer died when', 'James Smith Jr. New Jersey political figure obituary', 'James Smith Jr. prosecutor death newspaper archive', 'James Smith Jr. Essex County attorney died date', 'James Smith Jr. New Jersey genealogy death' ] print(f'Executing {len(search_queries)} targeted searches for James Smith Jr. death information:') for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f' {i}. {query}') # Headers for web requests to avoid blocking headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.5', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Initialize results storage search_results = { 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'target_person': 'James Smith Jr.', 'objective': 'Find exact death date of James Smith Jr.', 'location': 'New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)', 'time_period': '1900-1910', 'queries': search_queries, 'results': [], 'death_date_candidates': [], 'obituary_info': [], 'genealogy_records': [], 'analysis': {} } print('\n=== EXECUTING DUCKDUCKGO SEARCHES ===') print('=' * 60) # Function to extract and analyze search results for death date information def analyze_death_date_content(html_content, query): """Extract and analyze death date search results from HTML content""" soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') results = [] # Look for various result container patterns result_containers = soup.find_all(['div', 'article'], class_=lambda x: x and any(term in str(x).lower() for term in ['result', 'web-result', 'links_main'])) if not result_containers: # Fallback: look for any links that might be results result_containers = soup.find_all('a', href=True) for container in result_containers[:25]: # Check more results for death date info try: # Extract title title_elem = container.find(['h2', 'h3', 'a']) or container title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link_elem = container.find('a', href=True) or (container if container.name == 'a' else None) link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet/description snippet_elem = container.find(['p', 'span', 'div'], class_=lambda x: x and 'snippet' in str(x).lower()) or container.find('p') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' # Skip if no meaningful content if len(title) < 5 or title == 'No title': continue # Calculate relevance score for death date information combined_text = f'{title} {snippet} {link}'.lower() relevance_score = 0 matched_terms = [] death_date_indicators = [] # Key terms for James Smith Jr. death date information key_terms = { 'james smith jr': 8, 'james smith junior': 8, 'obituary': 6, 'death': 5, 'died': 5, 'death date': 7, 'death record': 6, 'new jersey': 4, 'newark': 4, 'essex county': 5, 'prosecutor': 4, 'attorney': 3, 'lawyer': 3, 'political': 2, 'genealogy': 3, 'newspaper': 3, 'archive': 2, 'born': 2, 'burial': 3, 'cemetery': 3, 'funeral': 4 } # Look for specific death date patterns import re # Match various date formats: Month Day, Year or Day Month Year or MM/DD/YYYY date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}\s+(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})', combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) year_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', combined_text) for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in combined_text: relevance_score += weight matched_terms.append(term) # Check for death-related date mentions death_words = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'funeral', 'burial'] for date in date_patterns: for death_word in death_words: if death_word in combined_text: # Check if date appears near death word (within 100 characters) death_pos = combined_text.find(death_word) date_pos = combined_text.find(date.lower()) if abs(death_pos - date_pos) < 100: death_date_indicators.append(f'{date} (near "{death_word}")') relevance_score += 5 # Check for years near death words for year in year_patterns: for death_word in death_words: if death_word in combined_text: death_pos = combined_text.find(death_word) year_pos = combined_text.find(year) if abs(death_pos - year_pos) < 50: death_date_indicators.append(f'{year} (near "{death_word}")') relevance_score += 3 if relevance_score > 0: # Only include results with some relevance results.append({ 'title': title[:300], 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet[:500], 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'matched_terms': matched_terms, 'death_date_indicators': death_date_indicators, 'date_patterns': date_patterns, 'years_mentioned': year_patterns, 'query': query }) except Exception as e: continue # Skip problematic results return results # Execute searches for James Smith Jr. death date information for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f'\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}') print('-' * 50) try: # Construct DuckDuckGo search URL search_url = f'https://html.duckduckgo.com/html/?q={quote_plus(query)}' print(f'Requesting: {search_url}') response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if response.status_code == 200: print(f'‚úÖ Successfully retrieved search results (Status: {response.status_code})') # Save raw HTML for reference html_filename = f'james_smith_jr_search_{i}_{query.replace(" ", "_").replace("/", "_")[:40]}.html' html_filepath = os.path.join('workspace', html_filename) with open(html_filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Raw HTML saved to: {html_filepath}') # Analyze search results search_results_batch = analyze_death_date_content(response.text, query) print(f'Extracted {len(search_results_batch)} relevant results') # Display high-relevance results high_relevance = [r for r in search_results_batch if r['relevance_score'] >= 15] moderate_relevance = [r for r in search_results_batch if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15] if high_relevance: print(f'\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS ({len(high_relevance)}):') for j, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | {result["title"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f' Death date indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f' Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Link: {result["link"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:250]}...') print() if moderate_relevance: print(f'\n‚≠ê MODERATE RELEVANCE RESULTS ({len(moderate_relevance)}):') for j, result in enumerate(moderate_relevance[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:5])}') print(f' Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Dates: {result["date_patterns"]}') # Store results search_results['results'].extend(search_results_batch) # Identify death date candidates death_candidates = [r for r in search_results_batch if r['death_date_indicators'] or (r['relevance_score'] >= 10 and any(term in r['matched_terms'] for term in ['obituary', 'death', 'died']))] if death_candidates: print(f'\nüíÄ DEATH DATE CANDIDATES FOUND ({len(death_candidates)}):') for candidate in death_candidates: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {candidate["title"][:150]}...') print(f' Score: {candidate["relevance_score"]} | Death indicators: {candidate["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {candidate["date_patterns"]} | Years: {candidate["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(candidate["matched_terms"][:6])}') search_results['death_date_candidates'].append(candidate) else: print(f'‚ùå Request failed with status: {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error in search {i}: {str(e)}') print(f'Completed search {i}/{len(search_queries)}') time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH') print('=' * 80) # Sort all results by relevance score search_results['results'].sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) total_results = len(search_results['results']) print(f'Total results collected: {total_results}') print(f'Death date candidates: {len(search_results["death_date_candidates"])}') if search_results['results']: print('\nüèÜ TOP 10 HIGHEST SCORING RESULTS:') print('-' * 50) for i, result in enumerate(search_results['results'][:10], 1): print(f'{i:2d}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f' Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f' Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Link: {result["link"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:200]}...') print() # Analyze death date patterns all_death_indicators = [] all_date_patterns = [] all_years_mentioned = [] for result in search_results['results']: all_death_indicators.extend(result['death_date_indicators']) all_date_patterns.extend(result['date_patterns']) all_years_mentioned.extend(result['years_mentioned']) from collections import Counter death_date_frequency = Counter(all_death_indicators) date_pattern_frequency = Counter(all_date_patterns) year_frequency = Counter(all_years_mentioned) print('\nüìä DEATH DATE ANALYSIS:') print('-' * 30) if death_date_frequency: print('Death date indicators found:') for indicator, count in death_date_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {indicator}: {count} occurrences') else: print('No specific death date indicators found in search results') if date_pattern_frequency: print('\nSpecific date patterns found:') for date, count in date_pattern_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {date}: {count} occurrences') else: print('\nNo specific date patterns found') print('\nAll years mentioned in results:') for year, count in year_frequency.most_common(15): print(f' {year}: {count} occurrences') # Focus on high-confidence death date candidates print('\nüîç ANALYZING HIGH-CONFIDENCE DEATH DATE CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 60) high_confidence_death = [r for r in search_results['results'] if r['relevance_score'] >= 15 and (r['death_date_indicators'] or r['date_patterns'])] if high_confidence_death: for result in high_confidence_death: print(f'\nHigh-confidence result: {result["title"][:200]}...') print(f'Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f'Death date indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f'Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f'Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f'Matched terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"])}') print(f'Full snippet: {result["snippet"]}') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print('-' * 40) else: print('No high-confidence death date candidates found.') print('Showing moderate confidence results:') moderate_confidence = [r for r in search_results['results'] if r['relevance_score'] >= 8][:5] for result in moderate_confidence: print(f'\nModerate result: {result["title"][:200]}...') print(f'Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f'Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f'Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f'Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f'Matched terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f'Snippet: {result["snippet"][:300]}...') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print('-' * 40) # Save comprehensive results results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'james_smith_jr_death_date_search.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Summary statistics search_results['analysis'] = { 'total_results': total_results, 'high_relevance_count': len([r for r in search_results['results'] if r['relevance_score'] >= 15]), 'moderate_relevance_count': len([r for r in search_results['results'] if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15]), 'death_candidates_count': len(search_results['death_date_candidates']), 'death_indicators_found': len(all_death_indicators), 'date_patterns_found': len(all_date_patterns), 'unique_years_mentioned': len(set(all_years_mentioned)), 'most_common_death_indicators': dict(death_date_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_date_patterns': dict(date_pattern_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_years': dict(year_frequency.most_common(5)) } print(f'\nüìà FINAL STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total results: {search_results["analysis"]["total_results"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ High relevance (15+): {search_results["analysis"]["high_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Moderate relevance (8-14): {search_results["analysis"]["moderate_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death date candidates: {search_results["analysis"]["death_candidates_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death indicators found: {search_results["analysis"]["death_indicators_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date patterns found: {search_results["analysis"]["date_patterns_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Unique years mentioned: {search_results["analysis"]["unique_years_mentioned"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Most common years: {list(search_results["analysis"]["most_common_years"].keys())}') print('\nüéØ PRELIMINARY FINDINGS:') if search_results['analysis']['death_indicators_found'] > 0: print('‚úÖ Death-related information found in search results') print('‚úÖ Specific death date indicators identified') if search_results['analysis']['most_common_death_indicators']: most_likely = list(search_results['analysis']['most_common_death_indicators'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ Most frequently mentioned death indicator: {most_likely}') else: print('‚ùì No specific death date indicators found - may need more targeted searches') print('‚ùì Consider searching genealogy databases or newspaper archives directly') if search_results['analysis']['date_patterns_found'] > 0: print('‚úÖ Specific date patterns found in search results') if search_results['analysis']['most_common_date_patterns']: most_common_date = list(search_results['analysis']['most_common_date_patterns'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ Most frequently mentioned date pattern: {most_common_date}') else: print('‚ùì No specific date patterns found') print('\nüìã NEXT STEPS:') print('1. üîç Review saved HTML files for additional death date context') print('2. üîç Follow up on high-relevance links for detailed obituary information') print('3. üîç Cross-reference multiple sources to confirm exact death date') print('4. üîç Search New Jersey newspaper archives (1900-1910) directly') print('5. üîç Check genealogy databases like Ancestry.com or FamilySearch') print('6. üîç Look for Essex County death records or cemetery records') print('7. üîç Search New Jersey State Archives for official death certificates') print('\n=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH ================================================================================ Total results collected: 0 Death date candidates: 0 üìä DEATH DATE ANALYSIS: ------------------------------ No specific death date indicators found in search results No specific date patterns found All years mentioned in results: üîç ANALYZING HIGH-CONFIDENCE DEATH DATE CANDIDATES: ------------------------------------------------------------ No high-confidence death date candidates found. Showing moderate confidence results: üíæ COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS SAVED TO: workspace_webshaper_26/james_smith_jr_death_date_search.json üìà FINAL STATISTICS: ‚Ä¢ Total results: 0 ‚Ä¢ High relevance (15+): 0 ‚Ä¢ Moderate relevance (8-14): 0 ‚Ä¢ Death date candidates: 0 ‚Ä¢ Death indicators found: 0 ‚Ä¢ Date patterns found: 0 ‚Ä¢ Unique years mentioned: 0 ‚Ä¢ Most common years: [] üéØ PRELIMINARY FINDINGS: ‚ùì No specific death date indicators found - may need more targeted searches ‚ùì Consider searching genealogy databases or newspaper archives directly ‚ùì No specific date patterns found üìã NEXT STEPS: 1. üîç Review saved HTML files for additional death date context 2. üîç Follow up on high-relevance links for detailed obituary information 3. üîç Cross-reference multiple sources to confirm exact death date 4. üîç Search New Jersey newspaper archives (1900-1910) directly 5. üîç Check genealogy databases like Ancestry.com or FamilySearch 6. üîç Look for Essex County death records or cemetery records 7. üîç Search New Jersey State Archives for official death certificates === JAMES SMITH JR. Code Execution - Plan #6 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from collections import Counter print('=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - FIXING BEAUTIFULSOUP IMPORT ===') print('Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor') print('Time Period: 1900-1910') print('Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)') print('Objective: Analyze saved HTML files for exact death date information\n') # First, let's inspect what files we have in the workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' html_files = [] json_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if filename.endswith('.html') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: html_files.append(filename) elif filename.endswith('.json') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: json_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files and {len(json_files)} JSON files:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f' HTML {i}. {filename}') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): print(f' JSON {i}. {filename}') else: print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found') html_files = [] json_files = [] if not html_files: print('‚ùå No HTML search result files found to analyze') else: print(f'\nüìÅ ANALYZING {len(html_files)} HTML FILES FOR JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE:') print('=' * 80) # Initialize analysis results analysis_results = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'target_person': 'James Smith Jr.', 'location': 'New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)', 'time_period': '1900-1910', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'james_smith_mentions': [], 'death_information': [], 'obituary_data': [], 'date_patterns': [], 'potential_death_dates': [], 'genealogy_records': [] } # Function to extract and analyze death date information def analyze_death_date_content(html_content, query, filename): """Extract and analyze death date search results from HTML content""" soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') results = [] # Look for various result container patterns result_containers = soup.find_all(['div', 'article'], class_=lambda x: x and any(term in str(x).lower() for term in ['result', 'web-result', 'links_main'])) if not result_containers: # Fallback: look for any links that might be results result_containers = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f'Found {len(result_containers)} potential result containers') for container in result_containers[:30]: # Check more results for death date info try: # Extract title title_elem = container.find(['h2', 'h3', 'a']) or container title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link_elem = container.find('a', href=True) or (container if container.name == 'a' else None) link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet/description snippet_elem = container.find(['p', 'span', 'div'], class_=lambda x: x and 'snippet' in str(x).lower()) or container.find('p') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' # Skip if no meaningful content if len(title) < 5 or title == 'No title': continue # Calculate relevance score for death date information combined_text = f'{title} {snippet} {link}'.lower() relevance_score = 0 matched_terms = [] death_date_indicators = [] # Key terms for James Smith Jr. death date information key_terms = { 'james smith jr': 8, 'james smith junior': 8, 'obituary': 6, 'death': 5, 'died': 5, 'death date': 7, 'death record': 6, 'new jersey': 4, 'newark': 4, 'essex county': 5, 'prosecutor': 4, 'attorney': 3, 'lawyer': 3, 'political': 2, 'genealogy': 3, 'newspaper': 3, 'archive': 2, 'born': 2, 'burial': 3, 'cemetery': 3, 'funeral': 4 } # Look for specific death date patterns # Match various date formats: Month Day, Year or Day Month Year or MM/DD/YYYY date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}\s+(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})', combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) year_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', combined_text) for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in combined_text: relevance_score += weight matched_terms.append(term) # Check for death-related date mentions death_words = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'funeral', 'burial'] for date in date_patterns: for death_word in death_words: if death_word in combined_text: # Check if date appears near death word (within 100 characters) death_pos = combined_text.find(death_word) date_pos = combined_text.find(date.lower()) if abs(death_pos - date_pos) < 100: death_date_indicators.append(f'{date} (near "{death_word}")') relevance_score += 5 # Check for years near death words for year in year_patterns: for death_word in death_words: if death_word in combined_text: death_pos = combined_text.find(death_word) year_pos = combined_text.find(year) if abs(death_pos - year_pos) < 50: death_date_indicators.append(f'{year} (near "{death_word}")') relevance_score += 3 if relevance_score > 0: # Only include results with some relevance results.append({ 'title': title[:300], 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet[:500], 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'matched_terms': matched_terms, 'death_date_indicators': death_date_indicators, 'date_patterns': date_patterns, 'years_mentioned': year_patterns, 'query': query, 'source_file': filename }) except Exception as e: continue # Skip problematic results return results # Analyze each HTML file all_results = [] for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) print(f'\nAnalyzing File {i}: {filename}') print('-' * 50) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Extract the original query from filename query_mapping = { 'james_smith_jr_search_1': 'James Smith Jr. New Jersey death obituary', 'james_smith_jr_search_2': 'James Smith Jr. Essex County prosecutor died', 'james_smith_jr_search_3': 'James Smith Jr. Newark attorney death date', 'james_smith_jr_search_4': 'James Smith Jr. obituary New Jersey 1900-1910', 'james_smith_jr_search_5': 'James Smith Jr. death records Essex County NJ' } query = 'Unknown query' for key, value in query_mapping.items(): if key in filename: query = value break print(f'Original query: {query}') # Analyze search results search_results_batch = analyze_death_date_content(html_content, query, filename) print(f'Extracted {len(search_results_batch)} relevant results') # Display high-relevance results high_relevance = [r for r in search_results_batch if r['relevance_score'] >= 15] moderate_relevance = [r for r in search_results_batch if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15] if high_relevance: print(f'\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS ({len(high_relevance)}):') for j, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | {result["title"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f' Death date indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f' Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Link: {result["link"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:250]}...') print() if moderate_relevance: print(f'\n‚≠ê MODERATE RELEVANCE RESULTS ({len(moderate_relevance)}):') for j, result in enumerate(moderate_relevance[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:5])}') print(f' Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Dates: {result["date_patterns"]}') # Store results all_results.extend(search_results_batch) # Identify death date candidates death_candidates = [r for r in search_results_batch if r['death_date_indicators'] or (r['relevance_score'] >= 10 and any(term in r['matched_terms'] for term in ['obituary', 'death', 'died']))] if death_candidates: print(f'\nüíÄ DEATH DATE CANDIDATES FOUND ({len(death_candidates)}):') for candidate in death_candidates: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {candidate["title"][:150]}...') print(f' Score: {candidate["relevance_score"]} | Death indicators: {candidate["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {candidate["date_patterns"]} | Years: {candidate["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(candidate["matched_terms"][:6])}') analysis_results['potential_death_dates'].extend(death_candidates) # Look for James Smith Jr. mentions specifically page_text = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser').get_text(separator=' ', strip=True) page_text_lower = page_text.lower() james_smith_indicators = { 'james smith jr': page_text_lower.count('james smith jr'), 'james smith junior': page_text_lower.count('james smith junior'), 'james smith, jr': page_text_lower.count('james smith, jr') } total_mentions = sum(james_smith_indicators.values()) print(f'\nJames Smith Jr. mentions: {james_smith_indicators} (Total: {total_mentions})') if total_mentions > 0: analysis_results['james_smith_mentions'].append({ 'filename': filename, 'mentions': james_smith_indicators, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'results_found': len(search_results_batch), 'death_candidates': len(death_candidates) if death_candidates else 0 }) except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH') print('=' * 80) # Sort all results by relevance score all_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) total_results = len(all_results) total_james_smith_mentions = sum(mention['total_mentions'] for mention in analysis_results['james_smith_mentions']) total_death_candidates = len(analysis_results['potential_death_dates']) print(f'üìä ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files analyzed: {analysis_results["files_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total results extracted: {total_results}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total James Smith Jr. mentions: {total_james_smith_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death date candidates: {total_death_candidates}') if all_results: print('\nüèÜ TOP 10 HIGHEST SCORING RESULTS:') print('-' * 50) for i, result in enumerate(all_results[:10], 1): print(f'{i:2d}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f' Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f' Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Source: {result["source_file"]}') print(f' Link: {result["link"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:200]}...') print() # Analyze death date patterns all_death_indicators = [] all_date_patterns = [] all_years_mentioned = [] for result in all_results: all_death_indicators.extend(result['death_date_indicators']) all_date_patterns.extend(result['date_patterns']) all_years_mentioned.extend(result['years_mentioned']) death_date_frequency = Counter(all_death_indicators) date_pattern_frequency = Counter(all_date_patterns) year_frequency = Counter(all_years_mentioned) print('\nüìä DEATH DATE ANALYSIS:') print('-' * 30) if death_date_frequency: print('Death date indicators found:') for indicator, count in death_date_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {indicator}: {count} occurrences') else: print('No specific death date indicators found in search results') if date_pattern_frequency: print('\nSpecific date patterns found:') for date, count in date_pattern_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {date}: {count} occurrences') else: print('\nNo specific date patterns found') print('\nAll years mentioned in results:') for year, count in year_frequency.most_common(15): print(f' {year}: {count} occurrences') # Focus on high-confidence death date candidates print('\nüîç ANALYZING HIGH-CONFIDENCE DEATH DATE CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 60) high_confidence_death = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 15 and (r['death_date_indicators'] or r['date_patterns'])] if high_confidence_death: for result in high_confidence_death: print(f'\nHigh-confidence result: {result["title"][:200]}...') print(f'Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f'Death date indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f'Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f'Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f'Matched terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"])}') print(f'Source file: {result["source_file"]}') print(f'Full snippet: {result["snippet"]}') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print('-' * 40) else: print('No high-confidence death date candidates found.') print('Showing moderate confidence results:') moderate_confidence = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 8][:5] for result in moderate_confidence: print(f'\nModerate result: {result["title"][:200]}...') print(f'Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f'Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f'Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f'Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f'Matched terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f'Source: {result["source_file"]}') print(f'Snippet: {result["snippet"][:300]}...') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print('-' * 40) # Store comprehensive analysis analysis_results['all_results'] = all_results analysis_results['statistics'] = { 'total_results': total_results, 'high_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 15]), 'moderate_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15]), 'death_candidates_count': total_death_candidates, 'death_indicators_found': len(all_death_indicators), 'date_patterns_found': len(all_date_patterns), 'unique_years_mentioned': len(set(all_years_mentioned)), 'most_common_death_indicators': dict(death_date_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_date_patterns': dict(date_pattern_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_years': dict(year_frequency.most_common(5)) } # Save comprehensive results results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'james_smith_jr_death_date_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final statistics print(f'\nüìà FINAL STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total results: {analysis_results["statistics"]["total_results"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ High relevance (15+): {analysis_results["statistics"]["high_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Moderate relevance (8-14): {analysis_results["statistics"]["moderate_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death date candidates: {analysis_results["statistics"]["death_candidates_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death indicators found: {analysis_results["statistics"]["death_indicators_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date patterns found: {analysis_results["statistics"]["date_patterns_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Unique years mentioned: {analysis_results["statistics"]["unique_years_mentioned"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Most common years: {list(analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_years"].keys())}') # Final conclusion print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL CONCLUSION ON JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE') print('=' * 80) confidence_score = 0 if total_james_smith_mentions > 0: confidence_score += 20 if analysis_results['statistics']['death_indicators_found'] > 0: confidence_score += 30 if analysis_results['statistics']['date_patterns_found'] > 0: confidence_score += 25 if analysis_results['statistics']['high_relevance_count'] > 0: confidence_score += 15 if len(set(all_years_mentioned)) > 0: confidence_score += 10 print(f'üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {confidence_score}/100') if confidence_score >= 50: if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns']: most_likely_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ HIGH CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died on: {most_likely_date}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_date_patterns"][most_likely_date]} mentions') elif analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ MODERATE CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died in: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_years"][most_likely_year]} mentions') elif confidence_score >= 20: print('‚ö†Ô∏è MODERATE EVIDENCE FOUND:') print(f' James Smith Jr. mentions confirmed: {total_james_smith_mentions}') if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f' Possible death year: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Confidence level: {confidence_score}/100') print(' Recommend additional targeted searches for confirmation') else: print('‚ùå INSUFFICIENT EVIDENCE:') print(' Unable to determine James Smith Jr.\'s death date from current search results') print(' Recommend additional searches or different sources') print('\nüéØ FINAL RECOMMENDATION:') if analysis_results['statistics']['date_patterns_found'] > 0: most_common_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns'].keys())[0] print(f'Based on search result analysis, James Smith Jr. most likely died on {most_common_date}') print(f'This conclusion is based on {analysis_results["statistics"]["date_patterns_found"]} date pattern mentions') print(f'in the retrieved search results.') elif total_james_smith_mentions > 0: print('While James Smith Jr. content was found in search results, specific death') print('date information was not clearly identified. Consider searching:') print('‚Ä¢ New Jersey State Archives for death certificates') print('‚Ä¢ Essex County records and cemetery databases') print('‚Ä¢ Newark newspaper archives from 1900-1910') print('‚Ä¢ Genealogy databases like Ancestry.com or FamilySearch') else: print('No James Smith Jr. content found in current search results.') print('Recommend trying different search terms or sources.') print('\n=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output
Code Output: === JAMES SMITH JR. Execution failed - The code encountered the same critical import error: 'name BeautifulSoup is not defined' that prevented analysis of the HTML files. While the script successfully identified 5 HTML files and 7 JSON files in the workspace from previous searches, it failed to parse any HTML content due to the missing BeautifulSoup import statement. The code attempted to analyze each HTML file (ranging from 28,992 to 30,266 characters) but crashed on every file with the same BeautifulSoup error. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no death date information was extracted despite having HTML search data available. The analysis framework is well-designed with comprehensive death date detection logic, but the missing 'from bs4 import BeautifulSoup' import at the top of the script prevents any meaningful analysis. Immediate fix: Add the missing import statement 'from bs4 import BeautifulSoup' at the beginning of the code, then the existing HTML files can be properly analyzed for James Smith Jr.'s death date information.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re from collections import Counter print('=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - FIXING BEAUTIFULSOUP IMPORT ===') print('Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor') print('Time Period: 1900-1910') print('Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)') print('Objective: Analyze saved HTML files for exact death date information\n') # First, let's inspect what files we have in the workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' html_files = [] json_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if filename.endswith('.html') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: html_files.append(filename) elif filename.endswith('.json') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: json_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files and {len(json_files)} JSON files:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f' HTML {i}. {filename}') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): print(f' JSON {i}. {filename}') else: print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found') html_files = [] json_files = [] if not html_files: print('‚ùå No HTML search result files found to analyze') else: print(f'\nüìÅ ANALYZING {len(html_files)} HTML FILES FOR JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE:') print('=' * 80) # Initialize analysis results analysis_results = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'target_person': 'James Smith Jr.', 'location': 'New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)', 'time_period': '1900-1910', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'james_smith_mentions': [], 'death_information': [], 'obituary_data': [], 'date_patterns': [], 'potential_death_dates': [], 'genealogy_records': [] } # Function to extract and analyze death date information def analyze_death_date_content(html_content, query, filename): """Extract and analyze death date search results from HTML content""" soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') results = [] # Look for various result container patterns result_containers = soup.find_all(['div', 'article'], class_=lambda x: x and any(term in str(x).lower() for term in ['result', 'web-result', 'links_main'])) if not result_containers: # Fallback: look for any links that might be results result_containers = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f'Found {len(result_containers)} potential result containers') for container in result_containers[:30]: # Check more results for death date info try: # Extract title title_elem = container.find(['h2', 'h3', 'a']) or container title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link_elem = container.find('a', href=True) or (container if container.name == 'a' else None) link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet/description snippet_elem = container.find(['p', 'span', 'div'], class_=lambda x: x and 'snippet' in str(x).lower()) or container.find('p') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' # Skip if no meaningful content if len(title) < 5 or title == 'No title': continue # Calculate relevance score for death date information combined_text = f'{title} {snippet} {link}'.lower() relevance_score = 0 matched_terms = [] death_date_indicators = [] # Key terms for James Smith Jr. death date information key_terms = { 'james smith jr': 8, 'james smith junior': 8, 'obituary': 6, 'death': 5, 'died': 5, 'death date': 7, 'death record': 6, 'new jersey': 4, 'newark': 4, 'essex county': 5, 'prosecutor': 4, 'attorney': 3, 'lawyer': 3, 'political': 2, 'genealogy': 3, 'newspaper': 3, 'archive': 2, 'born': 2, 'burial': 3, 'cemetery': 3, 'funeral': 4 } # Look for specific death date patterns # Match various date formats: Month Day, Year or Day Month Year or MM/DD/YYYY date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}\s+(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})', combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) year_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', combined_text) for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in combined_text: relevance_score += weight matched_terms.append(term) # Check for death-related date mentions death_words = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'funeral', 'burial'] for date in date_patterns: for death_word in death_words: if death_word in combined_text: # Check if date appears near death word (within 100 characters) death_pos = combined_text.find(death_word) date_pos = combined_text.find(date.lower()) if abs(death_pos - date_pos) < 100: death_date_indicators.append(f'{date} (near "{death_word}")') relevance_score += 5 # Check for years near death words for year in year_patterns: for death_word in death_words: if death_word in combined_text: death_pos = combined_text.find(death_word) year_pos = combined_text.find(year) if abs(death_pos - year_pos) < 50: death_date_indicators.append(f'{year} (near "{death_word}")') relevance_score += 3 if relevance_score > 0: # Only include results with some relevance results.append({ 'title': title[:300], 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet[:500], 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'matched_terms': matched_terms, 'death_date_indicators': death_date_indicators, 'date_patterns': date_patterns, 'years_mentioned': year_patterns, 'query': query, 'source_file': filename }) except Exception as e: continue # Skip problematic results return results # Analyze each HTML file all_results = [] for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) print(f'\nAnalyzing File {i}: {filename}') print('-' * 50) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Extract the original query from filename query_mapping = { 'james_smith_jr_search_1': 'James Smith Jr. New Jersey death obituary', 'james_smith_jr_search_2': 'James Smith Jr. Essex County prosecutor died', 'james_smith_jr_search_3': 'James Smith Jr. Newark attorney death date', 'james_smith_jr_search_4': 'James Smith Jr. obituary New Jersey 1900-1910', 'james_smith_jr_search_5': 'James Smith Jr. death records Essex County NJ' } query = 'Unknown query' for key, value in query_mapping.items(): if key in filename: query = value break print(f'Original query: {query}') # Analyze search results search_results_batch = analyze_death_date_content(html_content, query, filename) print(f'Extracted {len(search_results_batch)} relevant results') # Display high-relevance results high_relevance = [r for r in search_results_batch if r['relevance_score'] >= 15] moderate_relevance = [r for r in search_results_batch if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15] if high_relevance: print(f'\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS ({len(high_relevance)}):') for j, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | {result["title"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f' Death date indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f' Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Link: {result["link"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:250]}...') print() if moderate_relevance: print(f'\n‚≠ê MODERATE RELEVANCE RESULTS ({len(moderate_relevance)}):') for j, result in enumerate(moderate_relevance[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:5])}') print(f' Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Dates: {result["date_patterns"]}') # Store results all_results.extend(search_results_batch) # Identify death date candidates death_candidates = [r for r in search_results_batch if r['death_date_indicators'] or (r['relevance_score'] >= 10 and any(term in r['matched_terms'] for term in ['obituary', 'death', 'died']))] if death_candidates: print(f'\nüíÄ DEATH DATE CANDIDATES FOUND ({len(death_candidates)}):') for candidate in death_candidates: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {candidate["title"][:150]}...') print(f' Score: {candidate["relevance_score"]} | Death indicators: {candidate["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {candidate["date_patterns"]} | Years: {candidate["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(candidate["matched_terms"][:6])}') analysis_results['potential_death_dates'].extend(death_candidates) # Look for James Smith Jr. mentions specifically page_text = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser').get_text(separator=' ', strip=True) page_text_lower = page_text.lower() james_smith_indicators = { 'james smith jr': page_text_lower.count('james smith jr'), 'james smith junior': page_text_lower.count('james smith junior'), 'james smith, jr': page_text_lower.count('james smith, jr') } total_mentions = sum(james_smith_indicators.values()) print(f'\nJames Smith Jr. mentions: {james_smith_indicators} (Total: {total_mentions})') if total_mentions > 0: analysis_results['james_smith_mentions'].append({ 'filename': filename, 'mentions': james_smith_indicators, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'results_found': len(search_results_batch), 'death_candidates': len(death_candidates) if death_candidates else 0 }) except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH') print('=' * 80) # Sort all results by relevance score all_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) total_results = len(all_results) total_james_smith_mentions = sum(mention['total_mentions'] for mention in analysis_results['james_smith_mentions']) total_death_candidates = len(analysis_results['potential_death_dates']) print(f'üìä ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files analyzed: {analysis_results["files_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total results extracted: {total_results}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total James Smith Jr. mentions: {total_james_smith_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death date candidates: {total_death_candidates}') if all_results: print('\nüèÜ TOP 10 HIGHEST SCORING RESULTS:') print('-' * 50) for i, result in enumerate(all_results[:10], 1): print(f'{i:2d}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f' Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f' Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Source: {result["source_file"]}') print(f' Link: {result["link"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:200]}...') print() # Analyze death date patterns all_death_indicators = [] all_date_patterns = [] all_years_mentioned = [] for result in all_results: all_death_indicators.extend(result['death_date_indicators']) all_date_patterns.extend(result['date_patterns']) all_years_mentioned.extend(result['years_mentioned']) death_date_frequency = Counter(all_death_indicators) date_pattern_frequency = Counter(all_date_patterns) year_frequency = Counter(all_years_mentioned) print('\nüìä DEATH DATE ANALYSIS:') print('-' * 30) if death_date_frequency: print('Death date indicators found:') for indicator, count in death_date_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {indicator}: {count} occurrences') else: print('No specific death date indicators found in search results') if date_pattern_frequency: print('\nSpecific date patterns found:') for date, count in date_pattern_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {date}: {count} occurrences') else: print('\nNo specific date patterns found') print('\nAll years mentioned in results:') for year, count in year_frequency.most_common(15): print(f' {year}: {count} occurrences') # Focus on high-confidence death date candidates print('\nüîç ANALYZING HIGH-CONFIDENCE DEATH DATE CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 60) high_confidence_death = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 15 and (r['death_date_indicators'] or r['date_patterns'])] if high_confidence_death: for result in high_confidence_death: print(f'\nHigh-confidence result: {result["title"][:200]}...') print(f'Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f'Death date indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f'Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f'Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f'Matched terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"])}') print(f'Source file: {result["source_file"]}') print(f'Full snippet: {result["snippet"]}') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print('-' * 40) else: print('No high-confidence death date candidates found.') print('Showing moderate confidence results:') moderate_confidence = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 8][:5] for result in moderate_confidence: print(f'\nModerate result: {result["title"][:200]}...') print(f'Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f'Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f'Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f'Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f'Matched terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f'Source: {result["source_file"]}') print(f'Snippet: {result["snippet"][:300]}...') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print('-' * 40) # Store comprehensive analysis analysis_results['all_results'] = all_results analysis_results['statistics'] = { 'total_results': total_results, 'high_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 15]), 'moderate_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15]), 'death_candidates_count': total_death_candidates, 'death_indicators_found': len(all_death_indicators), 'date_patterns_found': len(all_date_patterns), 'unique_years_mentioned': len(set(all_years_mentioned)), 'most_common_death_indicators': dict(death_date_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_date_patterns': dict(date_pattern_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_years': dict(year_frequency.most_common(5)) } # Save comprehensive results results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'james_smith_jr_death_date_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final statistics print(f'\nüìà FINAL STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total results: {analysis_results["statistics"]["total_results"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ High relevance (15+): {analysis_results["statistics"]["high_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Moderate relevance (8-14): {analysis_results["statistics"]["moderate_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death date candidates: {analysis_results["statistics"]["death_candidates_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death indicators found: {analysis_results["statistics"]["death_indicators_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date patterns found: {analysis_results["statistics"]["date_patterns_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Unique years mentioned: {analysis_results["statistics"]["unique_years_mentioned"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Most common years: {list(analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_years"].keys())}') # Final conclusion print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL CONCLUSION ON JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE') print('=' * 80) confidence_score = 0 if total_james_smith_mentions > 0: confidence_score += 20 if analysis_results['statistics']['death_indicators_found'] > 0: confidence_score += 30 if analysis_results['statistics']['date_patterns_found'] > 0: confidence_score += 25 if analysis_results['statistics']['high_relevance_count'] > 0: confidence_score += 15 if len(set(all_years_mentioned)) > 0: confidence_score += 10 print(f'üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {confidence_score}/100') if confidence_score >= 50: if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns']: most_likely_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ HIGH CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died on: {most_likely_date}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_date_patterns"][most_likely_date]} mentions') elif analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ MODERATE CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died in: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_years"][most_likely_year]} mentions') elif confidence_score >= 20: print('‚ö†Ô∏è MODERATE EVIDENCE FOUND:') print(f' James Smith Jr. mentions confirmed: {total_james_smith_mentions}') if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f' Possible death year: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Confidence level: {confidence_score}/100') print(' Recommend additional targeted searches for confirmation') else: print('‚ùå INSUFFICIENT EVIDENCE:') print(' Unable to determine James Smith Jr.\'s death date from current search results') print(' Recommend additional searches or different sources') print('\nüéØ FINAL RECOMMENDATION:') if analysis_results['statistics']['date_patterns_found'] > 0: most_common_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns'].keys())[0] print(f'Based on search result analysis, James Smith Jr. most likely died on {most_common_date}') print(f'This conclusion is based on {analysis_results["statistics"]["date_patterns_found"]} date pattern mentions') print(f'in the retrieved search results.') elif total_james_smith_mentions > 0: print('While James Smith Jr. content was found in search results, specific death') print('date information was not clearly identified. Consider searching:') print('‚Ä¢ New Jersey State Archives for death certificates') print('‚Ä¢ Essex County records and cemetery databases') print('‚Ä¢ Newark newspaper archives from 1900-1910') print('‚Ä¢ Genealogy databases like Ancestry.com or FamilySearch') else: print('No James Smith Jr. content found in current search results.') print('Recommend trying different search terms or sources.') print('\n=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output
Code Output: === JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - FIXING BEAUTIFULSOUP IMPORT === Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor Time Period: 1900-1910 Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County) Objective: Analyze saved HTML files for exact death date information Found 5 HTML files and 7 JSON files: HTML 1. james_smith_jr_search_2_James_Smith_Jr._Essex_County_prosecutor_.html HTML 2. james_smith_jr_search_4_James_Smith_Jr._obituary_New_Jersey_1900.html HTML 3. james_smith_jr_search_3_James_Smith_Jr._Newark_attorney_death_da.html HTML 4. james_smith_jr_search_5_James_Smith_Jr._death_records_Essex_Coun.html HTML 5. james_smith_jr_search_1_James_Smith_Jr._New_Jersey_death_obituar.html JSON 1. james_smith_jr_manual_research_plan_20250807_084918.json JSON 2. james_smith_jr_final_status_20250807_084752.json JSON 3. james_smith_jr_research_checklist.json JSON 4. james_smith_jr_death_date_search.json JSON 5. james_smith_jr_web_research_20250807_084527.json JSON 6. james_smith_jr_all_findings_20250807_084642.json JSON 7. james_smith_jr_biographical_search_20250807_084312.json üìÅ ANALYZING 5 HTML FILES FOR JAMES SMITH JR. Code Execution - Plan #6 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import os import json import re from collections import Counter print('=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - CORRECTED BEAUTIFULSOUP IMPORT ===') print('Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor') print('Time Period: 1900-1910') print('Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)') print('Objective: Analyze saved HTML files for exact death date information\n') # First, let's inspect what files we have in the workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' html_files = [] json_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if filename.endswith('.html') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: html_files.append(filename) elif filename.endswith('.json') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: json_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files and {len(json_files)} JSON files:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f' HTML {i}. {filename}') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): print(f' JSON {i}. {filename}') else: print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found') html_files = [] json_files = [] if not html_files: print('‚ùå No HTML search result files found to analyze') else: print(f'\nüìÅ ANALYZING {len(html_files)} HTML FILES FOR JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE:') print('=' * 80) # Initialize analysis results analysis_results = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'target_person': 'James Smith Jr.', 'location': 'New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)', 'time_period': '1900-1910', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'james_smith_mentions': [], 'death_information': [], 'obituary_data': [], 'date_patterns': [], 'potential_death_dates': [], 'genealogy_records': [] } # Function to extract and analyze death date information def analyze_death_date_content(html_content, query, filename): """Extract and analyze death date search results from HTML content""" soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') results = [] # Look for various result container patterns result_containers = soup.find_all(['div', 'article'], class_=lambda x: x and any(term in str(x).lower() for term in ['result', 'web-result', 'links_main'])) if not result_containers: # Fallback: look for any links that might be results result_containers = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f'Found {len(result_containers)} potential result containers') for container in result_containers[:30]: # Check more results for death date info try: # Extract title title_elem = container.find(['h2', 'h3', 'a']) or container title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link_elem = container.find('a', href=True) or (container if container.name == 'a' else None) link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet/description snippet_elem = container.find(['p', 'span', 'div'], class_=lambda x: x and 'snippet' in str(x).lower()) or container.find('p') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' # Skip if no meaningful content if len(title) < 5 or title == 'No title': continue # Calculate relevance score for death date information combined_text = f'{title} {snippet} {link}'.lower() relevance_score = 0 matched_terms = [] death_date_indicators = [] # Key terms for James Smith Jr. death date information key_terms = { 'james smith jr': 8, 'james smith junior': 8, 'obituary': 6, 'death': 5, 'died': 5, 'death date': 7, 'death record': 6, 'new jersey': 4, 'newark': 4, 'essex county': 5, 'prosecutor': 4, 'attorney': 3, 'lawyer': 3, 'political': 2, 'genealogy': 3, 'newspaper': 3, 'archive': 2, 'born': 2, 'burial': 3, 'cemetery': 3, 'funeral': 4 } # Look for specific death date patterns # Match various date formats: Month Day, Year or Day Month Year or MM/DD/YYYY date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}\s+(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})', combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) year_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', combined_text) for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in combined_text: relevance_score += weight matched_terms.append(term) # Check for death-related date mentions death_words = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'funeral', 'burial'] for date in date_patterns: for death_word in death_words: if death_word in combined_text: # Check if date appears near death word (within 100 characters) death_pos = combined_text.find(death_word) date_pos = combined_text.find(date.lower()) if abs(death_pos - date_pos) < 100: death_date_indicators.append(f'{date} (near "{death_word}")') relevance_score += 5 # Check for years near death words for year in year_patterns: for death_word in death_words: if death_word in combined_text: death_pos = combined_text.find(death_word) year_pos = combined_text.find(year) if abs(death_pos - year_pos) < 50: death_date_indicators.append(f'{year} (near "{death_word}")') relevance_score += 3 if relevance_score > 0: # Only include results with some relevance results.append({ 'title': title[:300], 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet[:500], 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'matched_terms': matched_terms, 'death_date_indicators': death_date_indicators, 'date_patterns': date_patterns, 'years_mentioned': year_patterns, 'query': query, 'source_file': filename }) except Exception as e: continue # Skip problematic results return results # Analyze each HTML file all_results = [] for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) print(f'\nAnalyzing File {i}: {filename}') print('-' * 50) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Extract the original query from filename query_mapping = { 'james_smith_jr_search_1': 'James Smith Jr. New Jersey death obituary', 'james_smith_jr_search_2': 'James Smith Jr. Essex County prosecutor died', 'james_smith_jr_search_3': 'James Smith Jr. Newark attorney death date', 'james_smith_jr_search_4': 'James Smith Jr. obituary New Jersey 1900-1910', 'james_smith_jr_search_5': 'James Smith Jr. death records Essex County NJ' } query = 'Unknown query' for key, value in query_mapping.items(): if key in filename: query = value break print(f'Original query: {query}') # Analyze search results search_results_batch = analyze_death_date_content(html_content, query, filename) print(f'Extracted {len(search_results_batch)} relevant results') # Display high-relevance results high_relevance = [r for r in search_results_batch if r['relevance_score'] >= 15] moderate_relevance = [r for r in search_results_batch if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15] if high_relevance: print(f'\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS ({len(high_relevance)}):') for j, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | {result["title"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f' Death date indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f' Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Link: {result["link"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:250]}...') print() if moderate_relevance: print(f'\n‚≠ê MODERATE RELEVANCE RESULTS ({len(moderate_relevance)}):') for j, result in enumerate(moderate_relevance[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:5])}') print(f' Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Dates: {result["date_patterns"]}') # Store results all_results.extend(search_results_batch) # Identify death date candidates death_candidates = [r for r in search_results_batch if r['death_date_indicators'] or (r['relevance_score'] >= 10 and any(term in r['matched_terms'] for term in ['obituary', 'death', 'died']))] if death_candidates: print(f'\nüíÄ DEATH DATE CANDIDATES FOUND ({len(death_candidates)}):') for candidate in death_candidates: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {candidate["title"][:150]}...') print(f' Score: {candidate["relevance_score"]} | Death indicators: {candidate["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {candidate["date_patterns"]} | Years: {candidate["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(candidate["matched_terms"][:6])}') analysis_results['potential_death_dates'].extend(death_candidates) # Look for James Smith Jr. mentions specifically page_text = soup.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True) page_text_lower = page_text.lower() james_smith_indicators = { 'james smith jr': page_text_lower.count('james smith jr'), 'james smith junior': page_text_lower.count('james smith junior'), 'james smith, jr': page_text_lower.count('james smith, jr') } total_mentions = sum(james_smith_indicators.values()) print(f'\nJames Smith Jr. mentions: {james_smith_indicators} (Total: {total_mentions})') if total_mentions > 0: analysis_results['james_smith_mentions'].append({ 'filename': filename, 'mentions': james_smith_indicators, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'results_found': len(search_results_batch), 'death_candidates': len(death_candidates) if death_candidates else 0 }) except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH') print('=' * 80) # Sort all results by relevance score all_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) total_results = len(all_results) total_james_smith_mentions = sum(mention['total_mentions'] for mention in analysis_results['james_smith_mentions']) total_death_candidates = len(analysis_results['potential_death_dates']) print(f'üìä ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files analyzed: {analysis_results["files_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total results extracted: {total_results}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total James Smith Jr. mentions: {total_james_smith_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death date candidates: {total_death_candidates}') if all_results: print('\nüèÜ TOP 10 HIGHEST SCORING RESULTS:') print('-' * 50) for i, result in enumerate(all_results[:10], 1): print(f'{i:2d}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f' Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f' Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Source: {result["source_file"]}') print(f' Link: {result["link"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:200]}...') print() # Analyze death date patterns all_death_indicators = [] all_date_patterns = [] all_years_mentioned = [] for result in all_results: all_death_indicators.extend(result['death_date_indicators']) all_date_patterns.extend(result['date_patterns']) all_years_mentioned.extend(result['years_mentioned']) death_date_frequency = Counter(all_death_indicators) date_pattern_frequency = Counter(all_date_patterns) year_frequency = Counter(all_years_mentioned) print('\nüìä DEATH DATE ANALYSIS:') print('-' * 30) if death_date_frequency: print('Death date indicators found:') for indicator, count in death_date_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {indicator}: {count} occurrences') else: print('No specific death date indicators found in search results') if date_pattern_frequency: print('\nSpecific date patterns found:') for date, count in date_pattern_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {date}: {count} occurrences') else: print('\nNo specific date patterns found') print('\nAll years mentioned in results:') for year, count in year_frequency.most_common(15): print(f' {year}: {count} occurrences') # Focus on high-confidence death date candidates print('\nüîç ANALYZING HIGH-CONFIDENCE DEATH DATE CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 60) high_confidence_death = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 15 and (r['death_date_indicators'] or r['date_patterns'])] if high_confidence_death: for result in high_confidence_death: print(f'\nHigh-confidence result: {result["title"][:200]}...') print(f'Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f'Death date indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f'Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f'Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f'Matched terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"])}') print(f'Source file: {result["source_file"]}') print(f'Full snippet: {result["snippet"]}') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print('-' * 40) else: print('No high-confidence death date candidates found.') print('Showing moderate confidence results:') moderate_confidence = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 8][:5] for result in moderate_confidence: print(f'\nModerate result: {result["title"][:200]}...') print(f'Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f'Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f'Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f'Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f'Matched terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f'Source: {result["source_file"]}') print(f'Snippet: {result["snippet"][:300]}...') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print('-' * 40) # Store comprehensive analysis analysis_results['all_results'] = all_results analysis_results['statistics'] = { 'total_results': total_results, 'high_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 15]), 'moderate_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15]), 'death_candidates_count': total_death_candidates, 'death_indicators_found': len(all_death_indicators), 'date_patterns_found': len(all_date_patterns), 'unique_years_mentioned': len(set(all_years_mentioned)), 'most_common_death_indicators': dict(death_date_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_date_patterns': dict(date_pattern_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_years': dict(year_frequency.most_common(5)) } # Save comprehensive results results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'james_smith_jr_death_date_final_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final statistics print(f'\nüìà FINAL STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total results: {analysis_results["statistics"]["total_results"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ High relevance (15+): {analysis_results["statistics"]["high_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Moderate relevance (8-14): {analysis_results["statistics"]["moderate_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death date candidates: {analysis_results["statistics"]["death_candidates_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death indicators found: {analysis_results["statistics"]["death_indicators_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date patterns found: {analysis_results["statistics"]["date_patterns_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Unique years mentioned: {analysis_results["statistics"]["unique_years_mentioned"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Most common years: {list(analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_years"].keys())}') # Final conclusion print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL CONCLUSION ON JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE') print('=' * 80) confidence_score = 0 if total_james_smith_mentions > 0: confidence_score += 20 if analysis_results['statistics']['death_indicators_found'] > 0: confidence_score += 30 if analysis_results['statistics']['date_patterns_found'] > 0: confidence_score += 25 if analysis_results['statistics']['high_relevance_count'] > 0: confidence_score += 15 if len(set(all_years_mentioned)) > 0: confidence_score += 10 print(f'üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {confidence_score}/100') if confidence_score >= 50: if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns']: most_likely_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ HIGH CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died on: {most_likely_date}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_date_patterns"][most_likely_date]} mentions') elif analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ MODERATE CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died in: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_years"][most_likely_year]} mentions') elif confidence_score >= 20: print('‚ö†Ô∏è MODERATE EVIDENCE FOUND:') print(f' James Smith Jr. mentions confirmed: {total_james_smith_mentions}') if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f' Possible death year: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Confidence level: {confidence_score}/100') print(' Recommend additional targeted searches for confirmation') else: print('‚ùå INSUFFICIENT EVIDENCE:') print(' Unable to determine James Smith Jr.\'s death date from current search results') print(' Recommend additional searches or different sources') print('\nüéØ FINAL RECOMMENDATION:') if analysis_results['statistics']['date_patterns_found'] > 0: most_common_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns'].keys())[0] print(f'Based on search result analysis, James Smith Jr. most likely died on {most_common_date}') print(f'This conclusion is based on {analysis_results["statistics"]["date_patterns_found"]} date pattern mentions') print(f'in the retrieved search results.') elif total_james_smith_mentions > 0: print('While James Smith Jr. content was found in search results, specific death') print('date information was not clearly identified. Consider searching:') print('‚Ä¢ New Jersey State Archives for death certificates') print('‚Ä¢ Essex County records and cemetery databases') print('‚Ä¢ Newark newspaper archives from 1900-1910') print('‚Ä¢ Genealogy databases like Ancestry.com or FamilySearch') else: print('No James Smith Jr. content found in current search results.') print('Recommend trying different search terms or sources.') print('\n=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output
Code Output: === JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - CORRECTED BEAUTIFULSOUP IMPORT === Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor Time Period: 1900-1910 Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County) Objective: Analyze saved HTML files for exact death date information Found 5 HTML files and 8 JSON files: HTML 1. james_smith_jr_search_2_James_Smith_Jr._Essex_County_prosecutor_.html HTML 2. james_smith_jr_search_4_James_Smith_Jr._obituary_New_Jersey_1900.html HTML 3. james_smith_jr_search_3_James_Smith_Jr._Newark_attorney_death_da.html HTML 4. james_smith_jr_search_5_James_Smith_Jr._death_records_Essex_Coun.html HTML 5. james_smith_jr_search_1_James_Smith_Jr._New_Jersey_death_obituar.html JSON 1. james_smith_jr_manual_research_plan_20250807_084918.json JSON 2. james_smith_jr_final_status_20250807_084752.json JSON 3. james_smith_jr_death_date_analysis.json JSON 4. james_smith_jr_research_checklist.json JSON 5. james_smith_jr_death_date_search.json JSON 6. james_smith_jr_web_research_20250807_084527.json JSON 7. james_smith_jr_all_findings_20250807_084642.json JSON 8. james_smith_jr_biographical_search_20250807_084312.json üìÅ ANALYZING 5 HTML FILES FOR JAMES SMITH JR.
