Python Code python
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import os import json import re from collections import Counter print('=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - CORRECTED BEAUTIFULSOUP IMPORT ===') print('Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor') print('Time Period: 1900-1910') print('Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)') print('Objective: Analyze saved HTML files for exact death date information\n') # First, let's inspect what files we have in the workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' html_files = [] json_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if filename.endswith('.html') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: html_files.append(filename) elif filename.endswith('.json') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: json_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files and {len(json_files)} JSON files:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f' HTML {i}. {filename}') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): print(f' JSON {i}. {filename}') else: print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found') html_files = [] json_files = [] if not html_files: print('‚ùå No HTML search result files found to analyze') else: print(f'\nüìÅ ANALYZING {len(html_files)} HTML FILES FOR JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE:') print('=' * 80) # Initialize analysis results analysis_results = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'target_person': 'James Smith Jr.', 'location': 'New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)', 'time_period': '1900-1910', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'james_smith_mentions': [], 'death_information': [], 'obituary_data': [], 'date_patterns': [], 'potential_death_dates': [], 'genealogy_records': [] } # Function to extract and analyze death date information def analyze_death_date_content(html_content, query, filename): """Extract and analyze death date search results from HTML content""" soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') results = [] # Look for various result container patterns result_containers = soup.find_all(['div', 'article'], class_=lambda x: x and any(term in str(x).lower() for term in ['result', 'web-result', 'links_main'])) if not result_containers: # Fallback: look for any links that might be results result_containers = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f'Found {len(result_containers)} potential result containers') for container in result_containers[:30]: # Check more results for death date info try: # Extract title title_elem = container.find(['h2', 'h3', 'a']) or container title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' # Extract link link_elem = container.find('a', href=True) or (container if container.name == 'a' else None) link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' # Extract snippet/description snippet_elem = container.find(['p', 'span', 'div'], class_=lambda x: x and 'snippet' in str(x).lower()) or container.find('p') snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' # Skip if no meaningful content if len(title) < 5 or title == 'No title': continue # Calculate relevance score for death date information combined_text = f'{title} {snippet} {link}'.lower() relevance_score = 0 matched_terms = [] death_date_indicators = [] # Key terms for James Smith Jr. death date information key_terms = { 'james smith jr': 8, 'james smith junior': 8, 'obituary': 6, 'death': 5, 'died': 5, 'death date': 7, 'death record': 6, 'new jersey': 4, 'newark': 4, 'essex county': 5, 'prosecutor': 4, 'attorney': 3, 'lawyer': 3, 'political': 2, 'genealogy': 3, 'newspaper': 3, 'archive': 2, 'born': 2, 'burial': 3, 'cemetery': 3, 'funeral': 4 } # Look for specific death date patterns # Match various date formats: Month Day, Year or Day Month Year or MM/DD/YYYY date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}\s+(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})', combined_text, re.IGNORECASE) year_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', combined_text) for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in combined_text: relevance_score += weight matched_terms.append(term) # Check for death-related date mentions death_words = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'funeral', 'burial'] for date in date_patterns: for death_word in death_words: if death_word in combined_text: # Check if date appears near death word (within 100 characters) death_pos = combined_text.find(death_word) date_pos = combined_text.find(date.lower()) if abs(death_pos - date_pos) < 100: death_date_indicators.append(f'{date} (near "{death_word}")') relevance_score += 5 # Check for years near death words for year in year_patterns: for death_word in death_words: if death_word in combined_text: death_pos = combined_text.find(death_word) year_pos = combined_text.find(year) if abs(death_pos - year_pos) < 50: death_date_indicators.append(f'{year} (near "{death_word}")') relevance_score += 3 if relevance_score > 0: # Only include results with some relevance results.append({ 'title': title[:300], 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet[:500], 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'matched_terms': matched_terms, 'death_date_indicators': death_date_indicators, 'date_patterns': date_patterns, 'years_mentioned': year_patterns, 'query': query, 'source_file': filename }) except Exception as e: continue # Skip problematic results return results # Analyze each HTML file all_results = [] for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) print(f'\nAnalyzing File {i}: {filename}') print('-' * 50) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Extract the original query from filename query_mapping = { 'james_smith_jr_search_1': 'James Smith Jr. New Jersey death obituary', 'james_smith_jr_search_2': 'James Smith Jr. Essex County prosecutor died', 'james_smith_jr_search_3': 'James Smith Jr. Newark attorney death date', 'james_smith_jr_search_4': 'James Smith Jr. obituary New Jersey 1900-1910', 'james_smith_jr_search_5': 'James Smith Jr. death records Essex County NJ' } query = 'Unknown query' for key, value in query_mapping.items(): if key in filename: query = value break print(f'Original query: {query}') # Analyze search results search_results_batch = analyze_death_date_content(html_content, query, filename) print(f'Extracted {len(search_results_batch)} relevant results') # Display high-relevance results high_relevance = [r for r in search_results_batch if r['relevance_score'] >= 15] moderate_relevance = [r for r in search_results_batch if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15] if high_relevance: print(f'\nüéØ HIGH RELEVANCE RESULTS ({len(high_relevance)}):') for j, result in enumerate(high_relevance, 1): print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | {result["title"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f' Death date indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f' Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Link: {result["link"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:250]}...') print() if moderate_relevance: print(f'\n‚≠ê MODERATE RELEVANCE RESULTS ({len(moderate_relevance)}):') for j, result in enumerate(moderate_relevance[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | {result["title"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:5])}') print(f' Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Dates: {result["date_patterns"]}') # Store results all_results.extend(search_results_batch) # Identify death date candidates death_candidates = [r for r in search_results_batch if r['death_date_indicators'] or (r['relevance_score'] >= 10 and any(term in r['matched_terms'] for term in ['obituary', 'death', 'died']))] if death_candidates: print(f'\nüíÄ DEATH DATE CANDIDATES FOUND ({len(death_candidates)}):') for candidate in death_candidates: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {candidate["title"][:150]}...') print(f' Score: {candidate["relevance_score"]} | Death indicators: {candidate["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {candidate["date_patterns"]} | Years: {candidate["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(candidate["matched_terms"][:6])}') analysis_results['potential_death_dates'].extend(death_candidates) # Look for James Smith Jr. mentions specifically page_text = soup.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True) page_text_lower = page_text.lower() james_smith_indicators = { 'james smith jr': page_text_lower.count('james smith jr'), 'james smith junior': page_text_lower.count('james smith junior'), 'james smith, jr': page_text_lower.count('james smith, jr') } total_mentions = sum(james_smith_indicators.values()) print(f'\nJames Smith Jr. mentions: {james_smith_indicators} (Total: {total_mentions})') if total_mentions > 0: analysis_results['james_smith_mentions'].append({ 'filename': filename, 'mentions': james_smith_indicators, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'results_found': len(search_results_batch), 'death_candidates': len(death_candidates) if death_candidates else 0 }) except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH') print('=' * 80) # Sort all results by relevance score all_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) total_results = len(all_results) total_james_smith_mentions = sum(mention['total_mentions'] for mention in analysis_results['james_smith_mentions']) total_death_candidates = len(analysis_results['potential_death_dates']) print(f'üìä ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files analyzed: {analysis_results["files_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total results extracted: {total_results}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total James Smith Jr. mentions: {total_james_smith_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death date candidates: {total_death_candidates}') if all_results: print('\nüèÜ TOP 10 HIGHEST SCORING RESULTS:') print('-' * 50) for i, result in enumerate(all_results[:10], 1): print(f'{i:2d}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f' Title: {result["title"][:150]}...') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f' Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f' Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Source: {result["source_file"]}') print(f' Link: {result["link"]}') print(f' Snippet: {result["snippet"][:200]}...') print() # Analyze death date patterns all_death_indicators = [] all_date_patterns = [] all_years_mentioned = [] for result in all_results: all_death_indicators.extend(result['death_date_indicators']) all_date_patterns.extend(result['date_patterns']) all_years_mentioned.extend(result['years_mentioned']) death_date_frequency = Counter(all_death_indicators) date_pattern_frequency = Counter(all_date_patterns) year_frequency = Counter(all_years_mentioned) print('\nüìä DEATH DATE ANALYSIS:') print('-' * 30) if death_date_frequency: print('Death date indicators found:') for indicator, count in death_date_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {indicator}: {count} occurrences') else: print('No specific death date indicators found in search results') if date_pattern_frequency: print('\nSpecific date patterns found:') for date, count in date_pattern_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {date}: {count} occurrences') else: print('\nNo specific date patterns found') print('\nAll years mentioned in results:') for year, count in year_frequency.most_common(15): print(f' {year}: {count} occurrences') # Focus on high-confidence death date candidates print('\nüîç ANALYZING HIGH-CONFIDENCE DEATH DATE CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 60) high_confidence_death = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 15 and (r['death_date_indicators'] or r['date_patterns'])] if high_confidence_death: for result in high_confidence_death: print(f'\nHigh-confidence result: {result["title"][:200]}...') print(f'Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f'Death date indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f'Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f'Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f'Matched terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"])}') print(f'Source file: {result["source_file"]}') print(f'Full snippet: {result["snippet"]}') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print('-' * 40) else: print('No high-confidence death date candidates found.') print('Showing moderate confidence results:') moderate_confidence = [r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 8][:5] for result in moderate_confidence: print(f'\nModerate result: {result["title"][:200]}...') print(f'Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Query: {result["query"]}') print(f'Death indicators: {result["death_date_indicators"]}') print(f'Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') print(f'Years mentioned: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print(f'Matched terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:8])}') print(f'Source: {result["source_file"]}') print(f'Snippet: {result["snippet"][:300]}...') print(f'Link: {result["link"]}') print('-' * 40) # Store comprehensive analysis analysis_results['all_results'] = all_results analysis_results['statistics'] = { 'total_results': total_results, 'high_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 15]), 'moderate_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15]), 'death_candidates_count': total_death_candidates, 'death_indicators_found': len(all_death_indicators), 'date_patterns_found': len(all_date_patterns), 'unique_years_mentioned': len(set(all_years_mentioned)), 'most_common_death_indicators': dict(death_date_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_date_patterns': dict(date_pattern_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_years': dict(year_frequency.most_common(5)) } # Save comprehensive results results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'james_smith_jr_death_date_final_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final statistics print(f'\nüìà FINAL STATISTICS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total results: {analysis_results["statistics"]["total_results"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ High relevance (15+): {analysis_results["statistics"]["high_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Moderate relevance (8-14): {analysis_results["statistics"]["moderate_relevance_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death date candidates: {analysis_results["statistics"]["death_candidates_count"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death indicators found: {analysis_results["statistics"]["death_indicators_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date patterns found: {analysis_results["statistics"]["date_patterns_found"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Unique years mentioned: {analysis_results["statistics"]["unique_years_mentioned"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Most common years: {list(analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_years"].keys())}') # Final conclusion print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL CONCLUSION ON JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE') print('=' * 80) confidence_score = 0 if total_james_smith_mentions > 0: confidence_score += 20 if analysis_results['statistics']['death_indicators_found'] > 0: confidence_score += 30 if analysis_results['statistics']['date_patterns_found'] > 0: confidence_score += 25 if analysis_results['statistics']['high_relevance_count'] > 0: confidence_score += 15 if len(set(all_years_mentioned)) > 0: confidence_score += 10 print(f'üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {confidence_score}/100') if confidence_score >= 50: if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns']: most_likely_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ HIGH CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died on: {most_likely_date}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_date_patterns"][most_likely_date]} mentions') elif analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ MODERATE CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died in: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_years"][most_likely_year]} mentions') elif confidence_score >= 20: print('‚ö†Ô∏è MODERATE EVIDENCE FOUND:') print(f' James Smith Jr. mentions confirmed: {total_james_smith_mentions}') if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f' Possible death year: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Confidence level: {confidence_score}/100') print(' Recommend additional targeted searches for confirmation') else: print('‚ùå INSUFFICIENT EVIDENCE:') print(' Unable to determine James Smith Jr.\'s death date from current search results') print(' Recommend additional searches or different sources') print('\nüéØ FINAL RECOMMENDATION:') if analysis_results['statistics']['date_patterns_found'] > 0: most_common_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_date_patterns'].keys())[0] print(f'Based on search result analysis, James Smith Jr. most likely died on {most_common_date}') print(f'This conclusion is based on {analysis_results["statistics"]["date_patterns_found"]} date pattern mentions') print(f'in the retrieved search results.') elif total_james_smith_mentions > 0: print('While James Smith Jr. content was found in search results, specific death') print('date information was not clearly identified. Consider searching:') print('‚Ä¢ New Jersey State Archives for death certificates') print('‚Ä¢ Essex County records and cemetery databases') print('‚Ä¢ Newark newspaper archives from 1900-1910') print('‚Ä¢ Genealogy databases like Ancestry.com or FamilySearch') else: print('No James Smith Jr. content found in current search results.') print('Recommend trying different search terms or sources.') print('\n=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output
Code Output: === JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - CORRECTED BEAUTIFULSOUP IMPORT === Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor Time Period: 1900-1910 Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County) Objective: Analyze saved HTML files for exact death date information Found 5 HTML files and 8 JSON files: HTML 1. james_smith_jr_search_2_James_Smith_Jr._Essex_County_prosecutor_.html HTML 2. james_smith_jr_search_4_James_Smith_Jr._obituary_New_Jersey_1900.html HTML 3. james_smith_jr_search_3_James_Smith_Jr._Newark_attorney_death_da.html HTML 4. james_smith_jr_search_5_James_Smith_Jr._death_records_Essex_Coun.html HTML 5. james_smith_jr_search_1_James_Smith_Jr._New_Jersey_death_obituar.html JSON 1. james_smith_jr_manual_research_plan_20250807_084918.json JSON 2. james_smith_jr_final_status_20250807_084752.json JSON 3. james_smith_jr_death_date_analysis.json JSON 4. james_smith_jr_research_checklist.json JSON 5. james_smith_jr_death_date_search.json JSON 6. james_smith_jr_web_research_20250807_084527.json JSON 7. james_smith_jr_all_findings_20250807_084642.json JSON 8. james_smith_jr_biographical_search_20250807_084312.json üìÅ ANALYZING 5 HTML FILES FOR JAMES SMITH JR. Code Execution - Plan #6 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import re from collections import Counter print('=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - ALTERNATIVE HTML PARSING APPROACH ===') print('Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor') print('Time Period: 1900-1910') print('Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)') print('Objective: Analyze saved files for exact death date information\n') # First, let's inspect what files we have in the workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' html_files = [] json_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if filename.endswith('.html') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: html_files.append(filename) elif filename.endswith('.json') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: json_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files and {len(json_files)} JSON files:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f' HTML {i}. {filename}') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): print(f' JSON {i}. {filename}') else: print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found') html_files = [] json_files = [] # First, let's inspect existing JSON files to understand what data we already have print('\n=== INSPECTING EXISTING JSON FILES FOR PREVIOUS FINDINGS ===') print('=' * 70) for i, json_file in enumerate(json_files, 1): json_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_file) print(f'\nInspecting JSON File {i}: {json_file}') print('-' * 50) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'File size: {os.path.getsize(json_path):,} bytes') print(f'Data type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Top-level keys: {list(data.keys())}') # Look for death date related information death_related_keys = [] for key in data.keys(): if any(term in key.lower() for term in ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'date']): death_related_keys.append(key) if death_related_keys: print(f'Death-related keys found: {death_related_keys}') for key in death_related_keys[:3]: # Show first 3 value = data[key] if isinstance(value, (str, int, float)): print(f' {key}: {str(value)[:200]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') if value and len(value) > 0: print(f' First item: {str(value[0])[:150]}...') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}') # Look for any findings or results if 'results' in data: results = data['results'] print(f'Results found: {len(results) if isinstance(results, list) else "Not a list"}') if 'findings' in data: findings = data['findings'] print(f'Findings found: {type(findings)}') if isinstance(findings, dict): print(f' Findings keys: {list(findings.keys())}') # Look for any mentions of specific dates or years data_str = json.dumps(data, default=str).lower() date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', data_str) year_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', data_str) if date_patterns: print(f'Date patterns in JSON: {set(date_patterns)}') if year_patterns: year_counts = Counter(year_patterns) print(f'Years mentioned: {dict(year_counts.most_common(5))}') elif isinstance(data, list): print(f'List with {len(data)} items') if data and len(data) > 0: print(f'First item type: {type(data[0])}') if isinstance(data[0], dict): print(f'First item keys: {list(data[0].keys())[:5]}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading {json_file}: {str(e)}') # Now let's try a simple HTML parsing approach without BeautifulSoup print('\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES WITH SIMPLE TEXT PARSING ===') print('=' * 70) if html_files: analysis_results = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'target_person': 'James Smith Jr.', 'location': 'New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)', 'time_period': '1900-1910', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'james_smith_mentions': [], 'death_information': [], 'date_patterns_found': [], 'potential_death_dates': [], 'raw_text_analysis': [] } def simple_html_to_text(html_content): """Simple HTML to text conversion without BeautifulSoup""" # Remove script and style elements html_content = re.sub(r'<script[^>]*>.*?</script>', '', html_content, flags=re.DOTALL | re.IGNORECASE) html_content = re.sub(r'<style[^>]*>.*?</style>', '', html_content, flags=re.DOTALL | re.IGNORECASE) # Remove HTML tags text = re.sub(r'<[^>]+>', ' ', html_content) # Clean up whitespace text = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', text) text = text.strip() return text def extract_search_results(text): """Extract potential search results from text""" results = [] # Look for patterns that might be search result titles or snippets # Split text into potential result blocks sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]\s+', text) for sentence in sentences: sentence = sentence.strip() if len(sentence) < 20: # Skip very short sentences continue # Calculate relevance score sentence_lower = sentence.lower() relevance_score = 0 matched_terms = [] # Key terms for James Smith Jr. death date information key_terms = { 'james smith jr': 8, 'james smith junior': 8, 'james smith, jr': 8, 'obituary': 6, 'death': 5, 'died': 5, 'death date': 7, 'new jersey': 4, 'newark': 4, 'essex county': 5, 'prosecutor': 4, 'attorney': 3, 'lawyer': 3, 'funeral': 4, 'burial': 3, 'cemetery': 3 } for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in sentence_lower: relevance_score += weight matched_terms.append(term) if relevance_score > 0: # Look for date patterns in this sentence date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', sentence_lower) year_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', sentence_lower) results.append({ 'text': sentence[:400], 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'matched_terms': matched_terms, 'date_patterns': date_patterns, 'years_mentioned': year_patterns }) return results # Analyze each HTML file all_results = [] for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) print(f'\nAnalyzing HTML File {i}: {filename}') print('-' * 50) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Convert HTML to text text_content = simple_html_to_text(html_content) print(f'Extracted text size: {len(text_content):,} characters') # Extract the original query from filename query_mapping = { 'james_smith_jr_search_1': 'James Smith Jr. New Jersey death obituary', 'james_smith_jr_search_2': 'James Smith Jr. Essex County prosecutor died', 'james_smith_jr_search_3': 'James Smith Jr. Newark attorney death date', 'james_smith_jr_search_4': 'James Smith Jr. obituary New Jersey 1900-1910', 'james_smith_jr_search_5': 'James Smith Jr. death records Essex County NJ' } query = 'Unknown query' for key, value in query_mapping.items(): if key in filename: query = value break print(f'Original query: {query}') # Extract search results from text search_results = extract_search_results(text_content) print(f'Extracted {len(search_results)} relevant text segments') # Look for James Smith Jr. mentions text_lower = text_content.lower() james_smith_indicators = { 'james smith jr': text_lower.count('james smith jr'), 'james smith junior': text_lower.count('james smith junior'), 'james smith, jr': text_lower.count('james smith, jr') } total_mentions = sum(james_smith_indicators.values()) print(f'James Smith Jr. mentions: {james_smith_indicators} (Total: {total_mentions})') # Look for death-related information death_keywords = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'funeral', 'burial'] death_info = [] for keyword in death_keywords: if keyword in text_lower: # Find sentences containing the death keyword and James Smith sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]\s+', text_content) for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() if keyword in sentence_lower and any(name in sentence_lower for name in ['james smith jr', 'james smith junior', 'james smith, jr']): death_info.append({ 'keyword': keyword, 'sentence': sentence.strip()[:300] }) break if death_info: print(f'Death information found: {len(death_info)} instances') for info in death_info[:2]: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {info["keyword"]}: {info["sentence"][:150]}...') analysis_results['death_information'].extend(death_info) # Look for date patterns all_date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', text_lower) all_years = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', text_lower) if all_date_patterns: print(f'Date patterns found: {len(all_date_patterns)} - {list(set(all_date_patterns))[:5]}') analysis_results['date_patterns_found'].extend(all_date_patterns) if all_years: year_counts = Counter(all_years) print(f'Years mentioned: {dict(year_counts.most_common(5))}') # Store results all_results.extend(search_results) if total_mentions > 0: analysis_results['james_smith_mentions'].append({ 'filename': filename, 'mentions': james_smith_indicators, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'results_found': len(search_results), 'death_info_count': len(death_info), 'date_patterns': len(all_date_patterns), 'years_found': len(all_years) }) # Show top results for this file if search_results: search_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print(f'\nüéØ TOP RESULTS FROM THIS FILE:') for j, result in enumerate(search_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:4])}') print(f' Text: {result["text"][:200]}...') if result['date_patterns']: print(f' Dates: {result["date_patterns"]}') if result['years_mentioned']: print(f' Years: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print() except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH') print('=' * 80) # Sort all results by relevance score all_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) total_results = len(all_results) total_james_smith_mentions = sum(mention['total_mentions'] for mention in analysis_results['james_smith_mentions']) total_death_info = len(analysis_results['death_information']) total_date_patterns = len(analysis_results['date_patterns_found']) print(f'üìä ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ HTML files analyzed: {analysis_results["files_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ JSON files inspected: {len(json_files)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total relevant text segments: {total_results}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total James Smith Jr. mentions: {total_james_smith_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death information instances: {total_death_info}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date patterns found: {total_date_patterns}') if all_results: print('\nüèÜ TOP 10 HIGHEST SCORING TEXT SEGMENTS:') print('-' * 50) for i, result in enumerate(all_results[:10], 1): print(f'{i:2d}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:6])}') print(f' Text: {result["text"][:250]}...') if result['date_patterns']: print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') if result['years_mentioned']: print(f' Years: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print() # Analyze patterns all_date_patterns_combined = [] all_years_combined = [] for result in all_results: all_date_patterns_combined.extend(result['date_patterns']) all_years_combined.extend(result['years_mentioned']) all_date_patterns_combined.extend(analysis_results['date_patterns_found']) date_frequency = Counter(all_date_patterns_combined) year_frequency = Counter(all_years_combined) print('\nüìä DATE PATTERN ANALYSIS:') print('-' * 30) if date_frequency: print('Specific date patterns found:') for date, count in date_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {date}: {count} occurrences') else: print('No specific date patterns found') print('\nYears mentioned in all content:') for year, count in year_frequency.most_common(15): print(f' {year}: {count} occurrences') # Store comprehensive analysis analysis_results['all_results'] = all_results analysis_results['statistics'] = { 'total_results': total_results, 'high_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 15]), 'moderate_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15]), 'james_smith_mentions': total_james_smith_mentions, 'death_info_count': total_death_info, 'date_patterns_found': total_date_patterns, 'unique_years_mentioned': len(set(all_years_combined)), 'most_common_dates': dict(date_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_years': dict(year_frequency.most_common(5)) } # Save comprehensive results results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'james_smith_jr_complete_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final conclusion print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL CONCLUSION ON JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE') print('=' * 80) confidence_score = 0 if total_james_smith_mentions > 0: confidence_score += 20 if total_death_info > 0: confidence_score += 30 if total_date_patterns > 0: confidence_score += 25 if analysis_results['statistics']['high_relevance_count'] > 0: confidence_score += 15 if len(set(all_years_combined)) > 0: confidence_score += 10 print(f'üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {confidence_score}/100') if confidence_score >= 50: if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_dates']: most_likely_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_dates'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ HIGH CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died on: {most_likely_date}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_dates"][most_likely_date]} mentions') elif analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ MODERATE CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died in: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_years"][most_likely_year]} mentions') elif confidence_score >= 20: print('‚ö†Ô∏è MODERATE EVIDENCE FOUND:') print(f' James Smith Jr. mentions confirmed: {total_james_smith_mentions}') if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f' Possible death year: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Confidence level: {confidence_score}/100') print(' Recommend additional targeted searches for confirmation') else: print('‚ùå INSUFFICIENT EVIDENCE:') print(' Unable to determine James Smith Jr.\'s death date from current search results') print(' Recommend additional searches or different sources') print('\nüéØ FINAL RECOMMENDATION:') if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_dates']: most_common_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_dates'].keys())[0] print(f'Based on search result analysis, James Smith Jr. most likely died on {most_common_date}') print(f'This conclusion is based on {analysis_results["statistics"]["date_patterns_found"]} date pattern mentions') print(f'in the retrieved search results.') elif total_james_smith_mentions > 0: print('While James Smith Jr. content was found in search results, specific death') print('date information was not clearly identified. Consider searching:') print('‚Ä¢ New Jersey State Archives for death certificates') print('‚Ä¢ Essex County records and cemetery databases') print('‚Ä¢ Newark newspaper archives from 1900-1910') print('‚Ä¢ Genealogy databases like Ancestry.com or FamilySearch') else: print('No James Smith Jr. content found in current search results.') print('Recommend trying different search terms or sources.') else: print('No HTML files found to analyze') print('\n=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output
Code Output: === JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - ALTERNATIVE HTML PARSING APPROACH === Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor Time Period: 1900-1910 Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County) The code attempted to use a simple HTML-to-text parsing approach as a fallback, but encountered a 'name sentence_lower is not defined' error in the text analysis function. **PLAN** alignment: 0% - no death date information was extracted despite having 5 HTML files (28-30KB each) containing search results and 9 JSON files with previous research data. The analysis framework shows good design with comprehensive death date detection logic, but multiple variable scoping errors prevent execution. Immediate fix needed: (1) Ensure BeautifulSoup import is properly handled, (2) Fix the undefined 'key' variable in JSON analysis loop, and (3) Fix the undefined 'sentence_lower' variable in the text parsing function. Python Code python
import os import json import re from collections import Counter print('=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - ALTERNATIVE HTML PARSING APPROACH ===') print('Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor') print('Time Period: 1900-1910') print('Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)') print('Objective: Analyze saved files for exact death date information\n') # First, let's inspect what files we have in the workspace workspace_dir = 'workspace' html_files = [] json_files = [] if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if filename.endswith('.html') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: html_files.append(filename) elif filename.endswith('.json') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: json_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files and {len(json_files)} JSON files:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f' HTML {i}. {filename}') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): print(f' JSON {i}. {filename}') else: print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found') html_files = [] json_files = [] # First, let's inspect existing JSON files to understand what data we already have print('\n=== INSPECTING EXISTING JSON FILES FOR PREVIOUS FINDINGS ===') print('=' * 70) for i, json_file in enumerate(json_files, 1): json_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_file) print(f'\nInspecting JSON File {i}: {json_file}') print('-' * 50) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'File size: {os.path.getsize(json_path):,} bytes') print(f'Data type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Top-level keys: {list(data.keys())}') # Look for death date related information death_related_keys = [] for key in data.keys(): if any(term in key.lower() for term in ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'date']): death_related_keys.append(key) if death_related_keys: print(f'Death-related keys found: {death_related_keys}') for key in death_related_keys[:3]: # Show first 3 value = data[key] if isinstance(value, (str, int, float)): print(f' {key}: {str(value)[:200]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' {key}: List with {len(value)} items') if value and len(value) > 0: print(f' First item: {str(value[0])[:150]}...') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' {key}: Dict with keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}') # Look for any findings or results if 'results' in data: results = data['results'] print(f'Results found: {len(results) if isinstance(results, list) else "Not a list"}') if 'findings' in data: findings = data['findings'] print(f'Findings found: {type(findings)}') if isinstance(findings, dict): print(f' Findings keys: {list(findings.keys())}') # Look for any mentions of specific dates or years data_str = json.dumps(data, default=str).lower() date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', data_str) year_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', data_str) if date_patterns: print(f'Date patterns in JSON: {set(date_patterns)}') if year_patterns: year_counts = Counter(year_patterns) print(f'Years mentioned: {dict(year_counts.most_common(5))}') elif isinstance(data, list): print(f'List with {len(data)} items') if data and len(data) > 0: print(f'First item type: {type(data[0])}') if isinstance(data[0], dict): print(f'First item keys: {list(data[0].keys())[:5]}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading {json_file}: {str(e)}') # Now let's try a simple HTML parsing approach without BeautifulSoup print('\n=== ANALYZING HTML FILES WITH SIMPLE TEXT PARSING ===') print('=' * 70) if html_files: analysis_results = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'target_person': 'James Smith Jr.', 'location': 'New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)', 'time_period': '1900-1910', 'files_analyzed': len(html_files), 'james_smith_mentions': [], 'death_information': [], 'date_patterns_found': [], 'potential_death_dates': [], 'raw_text_analysis': [] } def simple_html_to_text(html_content): """Simple HTML to text conversion without BeautifulSoup""" # Remove script and style elements html_content = re.sub(r'<script[^>]*>.*?</script>', '', html_content, flags=re.DOTALL | re.IGNORECASE) html_content = re.sub(r'<style[^>]*>.*?</style>', '', html_content, flags=re.DOTALL | re.IGNORECASE) # Remove HTML tags text = re.sub(r'<[^>]+>', ' ', html_content) # Clean up whitespace text = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', text) text = text.strip() return text def extract_search_results(text): """Extract potential search results from text""" results = [] # Look for patterns that might be search result titles or snippets # Split text into potential result blocks sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]\s+', text) for sentence in sentences: sentence = sentence.strip() if len(sentence) < 20: # Skip very short sentences continue # Calculate relevance score sentence_lower = sentence.lower() relevance_score = 0 matched_terms = [] # Key terms for James Smith Jr. death date information key_terms = { 'james smith jr': 8, 'james smith junior': 8, 'james smith, jr': 8, 'obituary': 6, 'death': 5, 'died': 5, 'death date': 7, 'new jersey': 4, 'newark': 4, 'essex county': 5, 'prosecutor': 4, 'attorney': 3, 'lawyer': 3, 'funeral': 4, 'burial': 3, 'cemetery': 3 } for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in sentence_lower: relevance_score += weight matched_terms.append(term) if relevance_score > 0: # Look for date patterns in this sentence date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', sentence_lower) year_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', sentence_lower) results.append({ 'text': sentence[:400], 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'matched_terms': matched_terms, 'date_patterns': date_patterns, 'years_mentioned': year_patterns }) return results # Analyze each HTML file all_results = [] for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename) print(f'\nAnalyzing HTML File {i}: {filename}') print('-' * 50) try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Convert HTML to text text_content = simple_html_to_text(html_content) print(f'Extracted text size: {len(text_content):,} characters') # Extract the original query from filename query_mapping = { 'james_smith_jr_search_1': 'James Smith Jr. New Jersey death obituary', 'james_smith_jr_search_2': 'James Smith Jr. Essex County prosecutor died', 'james_smith_jr_search_3': 'James Smith Jr. Newark attorney death date', 'james_smith_jr_search_4': 'James Smith Jr. obituary New Jersey 1900-1910', 'james_smith_jr_search_5': 'James Smith Jr. death records Essex County NJ' } query = 'Unknown query' for key, value in query_mapping.items(): if key in filename: query = value break print(f'Original query: {query}') # Extract search results from text search_results = extract_search_results(text_content) print(f'Extracted {len(search_results)} relevant text segments') # Look for James Smith Jr. mentions text_lower = text_content.lower() james_smith_indicators = { 'james smith jr': text_lower.count('james smith jr'), 'james smith junior': text_lower.count('james smith junior'), 'james smith, jr': text_lower.count('james smith, jr') } total_mentions = sum(james_smith_indicators.values()) print(f'James Smith Jr. mentions: {james_smith_indicators} (Total: {total_mentions})') # Look for death-related information death_keywords = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'funeral', 'burial'] death_info = [] for keyword in death_keywords: if keyword in text_lower: # Find sentences containing the death keyword and James Smith sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]\s+', text_content) for sentence in sentences: sentence_lower = sentence.lower() if keyword in sentence_lower and any(name in sentence_lower for name in ['james smith jr', 'james smith junior', 'james smith, jr']): death_info.append({ 'keyword': keyword, 'sentence': sentence.strip()[:300] }) break if death_info: print(f'Death information found: {len(death_info)} instances') for info in death_info[:2]: print(f' ‚Ä¢ {info["keyword"]}: {info["sentence"][:150]}...') analysis_results['death_information'].extend(death_info) # Look for date patterns all_date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', text_lower) all_years = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', text_lower) if all_date_patterns: print(f'Date patterns found: {len(all_date_patterns)} - {list(set(all_date_patterns))[:5]}') analysis_results['date_patterns_found'].extend(all_date_patterns) if all_years: year_counts = Counter(all_years) print(f'Years mentioned: {dict(year_counts.most_common(5))}') # Store results all_results.extend(search_results) if total_mentions > 0: analysis_results['james_smith_mentions'].append({ 'filename': filename, 'mentions': james_smith_indicators, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'results_found': len(search_results), 'death_info_count': len(death_info), 'date_patterns': len(all_date_patterns), 'years_found': len(all_years) }) # Show top results for this file if search_results: search_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print(f'\nüéØ TOP RESULTS FROM THIS FILE:') for j, result in enumerate(search_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:4])}') print(f' Text: {result["text"][:200]}...') if result['date_patterns']: print(f' Dates: {result["date_patterns"]}') if result['years_mentioned']: print(f' Years: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print() except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH') print('=' * 80) # Sort all results by relevance score all_results.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) total_results = len(all_results) total_james_smith_mentions = sum(mention['total_mentions'] for mention in analysis_results['james_smith_mentions']) total_death_info = len(analysis_results['death_information']) total_date_patterns = len(analysis_results['date_patterns_found']) print(f'üìä ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ HTML files analyzed: {analysis_results["files_analyzed"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ JSON files inspected: {len(json_files)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total relevant text segments: {total_results}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total James Smith Jr. mentions: {total_james_smith_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death information instances: {total_death_info}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date patterns found: {total_date_patterns}') if all_results: print('\nüèÜ TOP 10 HIGHEST SCORING TEXT SEGMENTS:') print('-' * 50) for i, result in enumerate(all_results[:10], 1): print(f'{i:2d}. Score: {result["relevance_score"]} | Terms: {", ".join(result["matched_terms"][:6])}') print(f' Text: {result["text"][:250]}...') if result['date_patterns']: print(f' Date patterns: {result["date_patterns"]}') if result['years_mentioned']: print(f' Years: {result["years_mentioned"]}') print() # Analyze patterns all_date_patterns_combined = [] all_years_combined = [] for result in all_results: all_date_patterns_combined.extend(result['date_patterns']) all_years_combined.extend(result['years_mentioned']) all_date_patterns_combined.extend(analysis_results['date_patterns_found']) date_frequency = Counter(all_date_patterns_combined) year_frequency = Counter(all_years_combined) print('\nüìä DATE PATTERN ANALYSIS:') print('-' * 30) if date_frequency: print('Specific date patterns found:') for date, count in date_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {date}: {count} occurrences') else: print('No specific date patterns found') print('\nYears mentioned in all content:') for year, count in year_frequency.most_common(15): print(f' {year}: {count} occurrences') # Store comprehensive analysis analysis_results['all_results'] = all_results analysis_results['statistics'] = { 'total_results': total_results, 'high_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if r['relevance_score'] >= 15]), 'moderate_relevance_count': len([r for r in all_results if 8 <= r['relevance_score'] < 15]), 'james_smith_mentions': total_james_smith_mentions, 'death_info_count': total_death_info, 'date_patterns_found': total_date_patterns, 'unique_years_mentioned': len(set(all_years_combined)), 'most_common_dates': dict(date_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_years': dict(year_frequency.most_common(5)) } # Save comprehensive results results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'james_smith_jr_complete_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final conclusion print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL CONCLUSION ON JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE') print('=' * 80) confidence_score = 0 if total_james_smith_mentions > 0: confidence_score += 20 if total_death_info > 0: confidence_score += 30 if total_date_patterns > 0: confidence_score += 25 if analysis_results['statistics']['high_relevance_count'] > 0: confidence_score += 15 if len(set(all_years_combined)) > 0: confidence_score += 10 print(f'üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {confidence_score}/100') if confidence_score >= 50: if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_dates']: most_likely_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_dates'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ HIGH CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died on: {most_likely_date}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_dates"][most_likely_date]} mentions') elif analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f'‚úÖ MODERATE CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died in: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Evidence strength: {analysis_results["statistics"]["most_common_years"][most_likely_year]} mentions') elif confidence_score >= 20: print('‚ö†Ô∏è MODERATE EVIDENCE FOUND:') print(f' James Smith Jr. mentions confirmed: {total_james_smith_mentions}') if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f' Possible death year: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Confidence level: {confidence_score}/100') print(' Recommend additional targeted searches for confirmation') else: print('‚ùå INSUFFICIENT EVIDENCE:') print(' Unable to determine James Smith Jr.\'s death date from current search results') print(' Recommend additional searches or different sources') print('\nüéØ FINAL RECOMMENDATION:') if analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_dates']: most_common_date = list(analysis_results['statistics']['most_common_dates'].keys())[0] print(f'Based on search result analysis, James Smith Jr. most likely died on {most_common_date}') print(f'This conclusion is based on {analysis_results["statistics"]["date_patterns_found"]} date pattern mentions') print(f'in the retrieved search results.') elif total_james_smith_mentions > 0: print('While James Smith Jr. content was found in search results, specific death') print('date information was not clearly identified. Consider searching:') print('‚Ä¢ New Jersey State Archives for death certificates') print('‚Ä¢ Essex County records and cemetery databases') print('‚Ä¢ Newark newspaper archives from 1900-1910') print('‚Ä¢ Genealogy databases like Ancestry.com or FamilySearch') else: print('No James Smith Jr. content found in current search results.') print('Recommend trying different search terms or sources.') else: print('No HTML files found to analyze') print('\n=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')

'research_methods_attempted', 'total_results', 'research_results'] Error reading james_smith_jr_web_research_20250807_084527.json: name 'key' is not defined Inspecting JSON File 8: james_smith_jr_all_findings_20250807_084642.json -------------------------------------------------- File size: 3,618 bytes Data type: <class 'dict'> Top-level keys: ['research_timestamp', 'target_individual', 'key_facts_to_verify', 'research_status', 'total_findings', 'all_research_findings', 'high_priority_sources'] Error reading james_smith_jr_all_findings_20250807_084642.json: name DEATH DATE ================================================================================ üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: 0/100 ‚ùå INSUFFICIENT EVIDENCE: Unable to determine James Smith Jr.'s death date from current search results Recommend additional searches or different sources üéØ FINAL RECOMMENDATION: No James Smith Jr. content found in current search results. Python Code python
import os import json import re from collections import Counter print('=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH - ROBUST ANALYSIS APPROACH ===') print('Target: James Smith Jr. - New Jersey Attorney/Essex County Prosecutor') print('Time Period: 1900-1910') print('Location: New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)') print('Objective: Analyze saved files for exact death date information\n') # Ensure workspace directory exists workspace_dir = 'workspace' if not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found') exit() # Find all relevant files html_files = [] json_files = [] for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir): if filename.endswith('.html') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: html_files.append(filename) elif filename.endswith('.json') and 'james_smith_jr' in filename: json_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML files and {len(json_files)} JSON files:') for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): print(f' HTML {i}. {filename}') for i, filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): print(f' JSON {i}. {filename}') # Initialize comprehensive analysis results analysis_results = { 'timestamp': '2025-01-07', 'target_person': 'James Smith Jr.', 'location': 'New Jersey (Newark, Essex County)', 'time_period': '1900-1910', 'files_analyzed': {'html': len(html_files), 'json': len(json_files)}, 'james_smith_mentions': [], 'death_information': [], 'date_patterns_found': [], 'potential_death_dates': [], 'previous_research_summary': [], 'all_text_segments': [] } print('\n=== STEP 1: INSPECTING EXISTING JSON FILES FOR PREVIOUS RESEARCH ===') print('=' * 75) # First, let's safely inspect JSON files to understand previous research for i, json_filename in enumerate(json_files, 1): json_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_filename) print(f'\nInspecting JSON File {i}: {json_filename}') print('-' * 50) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: json_data = json.load(f) file_size = os.path.getsize(json_path) print(f'File size: {file_size:,} bytes') print(f'Data type: {type(json_data)}') if isinstance(json_data, dict): json_keys = list(json_data.keys()) print(f'Top-level keys ({len(json_keys)}): {json_keys[:8]}') # Show first 8 keys # Look for death-related information in keys death_related_keys = [] for json_key in json_keys: if any(term in str(json_key).lower() for term in ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'date']): death_related_keys.append(json_key) if death_related_keys: print(f'Death-related keys found: {death_related_keys}') # Examine death-related data for death_key in death_related_keys[:3]: # Examine first 3 death_value = json_data[death_key] if isinstance(death_value, str): print(f' {death_key}: {death_value[:200]}...') elif isinstance(death_value, list): print(f' {death_key}: List with {len(death_value)} items') if death_value: print(f' First item: {str(death_value[0])[:150]}...') elif isinstance(death_value, dict): print(f' {death_key}: Dict with keys: {list(death_value.keys())[:5]}') else: print(f' {death_key}: {type(death_value)} - {str(death_value)[:100]}...') # Look for results or findings if 'results' in json_data: results_data = json_data['results'] print(f'Results section found: {type(results_data)}') if isinstance(results_data, list): print(f' Results count: {len(results_data)}') elif isinstance(results_data, dict): print(f' Results keys: {list(results_data.keys())[:5]}') if 'findings' in json_data: findings_data = json_data['findings'] print(f'Findings section found: {type(findings_data)}') # Search for date patterns in the entire JSON content json_text = json.dumps(json_data, default=str).lower() date_patterns_in_json = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', json_text) year_patterns_in_json = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', json_text) if date_patterns_in_json: unique_dates = list(set(date_patterns_in_json)) print(f'Date patterns found in JSON: {unique_dates[:5]}') analysis_results['date_patterns_found'].extend(unique_dates) if year_patterns_in_json: year_counts = Counter(year_patterns_in_json) print(f'Years mentioned: {dict(year_counts.most_common(5))}') # Store summary of this JSON file analysis_results['previous_research_summary'].append({ 'filename': json_filename, 'file_size': file_size, 'keys_count': len(json_keys), 'death_related_keys': death_related_keys, 'has_results': 'results' in json_data, 'has_findings': 'findings' in json_data, 'date_patterns': len(date_patterns_in_json), 'years_mentioned': len(year_patterns_in_json) }) elif isinstance(json_data, list): print(f'List with {len(json_data)} items') if json_data: print(f'First item type: {type(json_data[0])}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error reading {json_filename}: {str(e)}') print(f'Error type: {type(e)}') print('\n=== STEP 2: ANALYZING HTML FILES WITH ROBUST TEXT PARSING ===') print('=' * 70) # Define robust HTML to text conversion function def robust_html_to_text(html_content): """Convert HTML to text using regex patterns""" try: # Remove script and style elements clean_html = re.sub(r'<script[^>]*>.*?</script>', '', html_content, flags=re.DOTALL | re.IGNORECASE) clean_html = re.sub(r'<style[^>]*>.*?</style>', '', clean_html, flags=re.DOTALL | re.IGNORECASE) # Remove HTML tags text_content = re.sub(r'<[^>]+>', ' ', clean_html) # Clean up whitespace text_content = re.sub(r'\s+', ' ', text_content) text_content = text_content.strip() return text_content except Exception as e: print(f'Error in HTML to text conversion: {str(e)}') return '' # Define function to extract relevant text segments def extract_relevant_segments(text_content): """Extract text segments relevant to James Smith Jr. death information""" segments = [] try: # Split text into sentences sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]\s+', text_content) for sentence in sentences: sentence = sentence.strip() if len(sentence) < 20: # Skip very short sentences continue # Convert to lowercase for analysis sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = 0 matched_terms = [] # Key terms for James Smith Jr. death date information key_terms = { 'james smith jr': 8, 'james smith junior': 8, 'james smith, jr': 8, 'obituary': 6, 'death': 5, 'died': 5, 'death date': 7, 'new jersey': 4, 'newark': 4, 'essex county': 5, 'prosecutor': 4, 'attorney': 3, 'lawyer': 3, 'funeral': 4, 'burial': 3, 'cemetery': 3, 'passed away': 5 } # Check for key terms for term, weight in key_terms.items(): if term in sentence_lower: relevance_score += weight matched_terms.append(term) if relevance_score > 0: # Look for date patterns in this sentence date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', sentence_lower) year_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', sentence_lower) segments.append({ 'text': sentence[:500], # Limit text length 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'matched_terms': matched_terms, 'date_patterns': date_patterns, 'years_mentioned': year_patterns }) except Exception as e: print(f'Error in segment extraction: {str(e)}') return segments # Analyze each HTML file all_text_segments = [] for i, html_filename in enumerate(html_files, 1): html_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, html_filename) print(f'\nAnalyzing HTML File {i}: {html_filename}') print('-' * 50) try: # Read HTML file with open(html_filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Convert HTML to text text_content = robust_html_to_text(html_content) print(f'Extracted text size: {len(text_content):,} characters') # Map filename to original query query_mapping = { 'james_smith_jr_search_1': 'James Smith Jr. New Jersey death obituary', 'james_smith_jr_search_2': 'James Smith Jr. Essex County prosecutor died', 'james_smith_jr_search_3': 'James Smith Jr. Newark attorney death date', 'james_smith_jr_search_4': 'James Smith Jr. obituary New Jersey 1900-1910', 'james_smith_jr_search_5': 'James Smith Jr. death records Essex County NJ' } original_query = 'Unknown query' for query_key, query_value in query_mapping.items(): if query_key in html_filename: original_query = query_value break print(f'Original query: {original_query}') # Extract relevant text segments text_segments = extract_relevant_segments(text_content) print(f'Extracted {len(text_segments)} relevant text segments') # Count James Smith Jr. mentions text_lower = text_content.lower() james_smith_counts = { 'james smith jr': text_lower.count('james smith jr'), 'james smith junior': text_lower.count('james smith junior'), 'james smith, jr': text_lower.count('james smith, jr') } total_mentions = sum(james_smith_counts.values()) print(f'James Smith Jr. mentions: {james_smith_counts} (Total: {total_mentions})') # Look for death-related information in sentences containing James Smith Jr. death_keywords = ['death', 'died', 'obituary', 'passed away', 'funeral', 'burial'] death_info_found = [] sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]\s+', text_content) for sentence in sentences: sentence_stripped = sentence.strip() sentence_lower = sentence.lower() # Check if sentence contains James Smith Jr. and death keywords has_james_smith = any(name in sentence_lower for name in ['james smith jr', 'james smith junior', 'james smith, jr']) if has_james_smith: for keyword in death_keywords: if keyword in sentence_lower: death_info_found.append({ 'keyword': keyword, 'sentence': sentence_stripped[:400], 'source_file': html_filename }) break if death_info_found: print(f'Death information found: {len(death_info_found)} instances') for death_info in death_info_found[:2]: # Show first 2 print(f' ‚Ä¢ {death_info["keyword"]}: {death_info["sentence"][:150]}...') analysis_results['death_information'].extend(death_info_found) # Find all date patterns and years in this file all_date_patterns = re.findall(r'\b(?:january|february|march|april|may|june|july|august|september|october|november|december)\s+\d{1,2},?\s+(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})|\b\d{1,2}/\d{1,2}/(?:19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', text_lower) all_years = re.findall(r'\b(19\d{2}|18\d{2})\b', text_lower) if all_date_patterns: unique_dates = list(set(all_date_patterns)) print(f'Date patterns found: {len(all_date_patterns)} total, {len(unique_dates)} unique') print(f' Unique dates: {unique_dates[:5]}') analysis_results['date_patterns_found'].extend(all_date_patterns) if all_years: year_counts = Counter(all_years) print(f'Years mentioned: {dict(year_counts.most_common(5))}') # Store file analysis results if total_mentions > 0: analysis_results['james_smith_mentions'].append({ 'filename': html_filename, 'original_query': original_query, 'mentions': james_smith_counts, 'total_mentions': total_mentions, 'text_segments_found': len(text_segments), 'death_info_count': len(death_info_found), 'date_patterns_count': len(all_date_patterns), 'years_found': len(all_years) }) # Add segments to overall collection for segment in text_segments: segment['source_file'] = html_filename segment['original_query'] = original_query all_text_segments.extend(text_segments) # Show top segments from this file if text_segments: text_segments.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) print(f'\nüéØ TOP SEGMENTS FROM THIS FILE:') for j, segment in enumerate(text_segments[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score: {segment["relevance_score"]} | Terms: {", ".join(segment["matched_terms"][:4])}') print(f' Text: {segment["text"][:200]}...') if segment['date_patterns']: print(f' Dates: {segment["date_patterns"]}') if segment['years_mentioned']: print(f' Years: {segment["years_mentioned"]}') print() except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {html_filename}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE SEARCH') print('=' * 80) # Sort all text segments by relevance score all_text_segments.sort(key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Calculate summary statistics total_text_segments = len(all_text_segments) total_james_smith_mentions = sum(mention['total_mentions'] for mention in analysis_results['james_smith_mentions']) total_death_info = len(analysis_results['death_information']) total_date_patterns = len(analysis_results['date_patterns_found']) print(f'üìä COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ HTML files analyzed: {analysis_results["files_analyzed"]["html"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ JSON files inspected: {analysis_results["files_analyzed"]["json"]}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total relevant text segments: {total_text_segments}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total James Smith Jr. mentions: {total_james_smith_mentions}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Death information instances: {total_death_info}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Date patterns found: {total_date_patterns}') if all_text_segments: print('\nüèÜ TOP 10 HIGHEST SCORING TEXT SEGMENTS:') print('-' * 50) for i, segment in enumerate(all_text_segments[:10], 1): print(f'{i:2d}. Score: {segment["relevance_score"]} | Source: {segment["source_file"]}') print(f' Query: {segment["original_query"]}') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(segment["matched_terms"][:6])}') print(f' Text: {segment["text"][:250]}...') if segment['date_patterns']: print(f' Date patterns: {segment["date_patterns"]}') if segment['years_mentioned']: print(f' Years: {segment["years_mentioned"]}') print() # Analyze all date patterns and years found all_date_patterns_combined = analysis_results['date_patterns_found'] all_years_combined = [] for segment in all_text_segments: all_years_combined.extend(segment['years_mentioned']) date_frequency = Counter(all_date_patterns_combined) year_frequency = Counter(all_years_combined) print('\nüìä DATE AND YEAR ANALYSIS:') print('-' * 30) if date_frequency: print('Specific date patterns found:') for date_pattern, count in date_frequency.most_common(10): print(f' {date_pattern}: {count} occurrences') else: print('No specific date patterns found') print('\nYears mentioned across all content:') for year, count in year_frequency.most_common(15): print(f' {year}: {count} occurrences') # Identify high-confidence death date candidates high_confidence_segments = [s for s in all_text_segments if s['relevance_score'] >= 15 and (s['date_patterns'] or s['years_mentioned'])] print('\nüîç HIGH-CONFIDENCE DEATH DATE CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 50) if high_confidence_segments: for i, segment in enumerate(high_confidence_segments[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. HIGH-CONFIDENCE SEGMENT:') print(f' Score: {segment["relevance_score"]} | Source: {segment["source_file"]}') print(f' Query: {segment["original_query"]}') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(segment["matched_terms"])}') if segment['date_patterns']: print(f' Date patterns: {segment["date_patterns"]}') if segment['years_mentioned']: print(f' Years: {segment["years_mentioned"]}') print(f' Text: {segment["text"]}') print('-' * 40) else: print('No high-confidence death date candidates found.') print('\nShowing moderate confidence segments:') moderate_segments = [s for s in all_text_segments if s['relevance_score'] >= 8][:5] for i, segment in enumerate(moderate_segments, 1): print(f'\n{i}. MODERATE CONFIDENCE:') print(f' Score: {segment["relevance_score"]} | Source: {segment["source_file"]}') print(f' Terms: {", ".join(segment["matched_terms"][:6])}') print(f' Text: {segment["text"][:300]}...') if segment['date_patterns']: print(f' Dates: {segment["date_patterns"]}') if segment['years_mentioned']: print(f' Years: {segment["years_mentioned"]}') # Store comprehensive analysis analysis_results['all_text_segments'] = all_text_segments analysis_results['final_statistics'] = { 'total_text_segments': total_text_segments, 'high_relevance_count': len([s for s in all_text_segments if s['relevance_score'] >= 15]), 'moderate_relevance_count': len([s for s in all_text_segments if 8 <= s['relevance_score'] < 15]), 'james_smith_mentions': total_james_smith_mentions, 'death_info_count': total_death_info, 'date_patterns_found': total_date_patterns, 'unique_years_mentioned': len(set(all_years_combined)), 'most_common_dates': dict(date_frequency.most_common(3)), 'most_common_years': dict(year_frequency.most_common(5)), 'high_confidence_candidates': len(high_confidence_segments) } # Save comprehensive results results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'james_smith_jr_robust_analysis.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {results_file}') # Final conclusion and confidence assessment print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('FINAL CONCLUSION ON JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE') print('=' * 80) # Calculate confidence score confidence_score = 0 if total_james_smith_mentions > 0: confidence_score += 20 if total_death_info > 0: confidence_score += 30 if total_date_patterns > 0: confidence_score += 25 if len(high_confidence_segments) > 0: confidence_score += 15 if len(set(all_years_combined)) > 0: confidence_score += 10 print(f'üìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {confidence_score}/100') if confidence_score >= 50: if analysis_results['final_statistics']['most_common_dates']: most_likely_date = list(analysis_results['final_statistics']['most_common_dates'].keys())[0] date_count = analysis_results['final_statistics']['most_common_dates'][most_likely_date] print(f'‚úÖ HIGH CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died on: {most_likely_date}') print(f' Evidence strength: {date_count} mentions across search results') elif analysis_results['final_statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['final_statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] year_count = analysis_results['final_statistics']['most_common_years'][most_likely_year] print(f'‚úÖ MODERATE CONFIDENCE RESULT:') print(f' James Smith Jr. likely died in: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Evidence strength: {year_count} mentions across search results') elif confidence_score >= 20: print('‚ö†Ô∏è MODERATE EVIDENCE FOUND:') print(f' James Smith Jr. mentions confirmed: {total_james_smith_mentions}') print(f' Death-related information found: {total_death_info} instances') if analysis_results['final_statistics']['most_common_years']: most_likely_year = list(analysis_results['final_statistics']['most_common_years'].keys())[0] print(f' Possible death year: {most_likely_year}') print(f' Confidence level: {confidence_score}/100') print(' Recommend additional targeted searches for confirmation') else: print('‚ùå INSUFFICIENT EVIDENCE:') print(' Unable to determine James Smith Jr.\'s death date from current search results') print(' Recommend additional searches or different sources') print('\nüéØ FINAL RECOMMENDATION:') if analysis_results['final_statistics']['most_common_dates']: most_common_date = list(analysis_results['final_statistics']['most_common_dates'].keys())[0] print(f'Based on comprehensive analysis, James Smith Jr. most likely died on {most_common_date}') print(f'This conclusion is based on {total_date_patterns} date pattern mentions') print(f'found across {len(html_files)} HTML search result files.') elif total_james_smith_mentions > 0: print('While James Smith Jr. content was found in search results, specific death') print('date information was not clearly identified. Consider searching:') print('‚Ä¢ New Jersey State Archives for death certificates') print('‚Ä¢ Essex County records and cemetery databases') print('‚Ä¢ Newark newspaper archives from 1900-1910') print('‚Ä¢ Genealogy databases like Ancestry.com or FamilySearch') print('‚Ä¢ New Jersey Bar Association historical records') else: print('No James Smith Jr. content found in current search results.') print('Recommend trying different search terms or sources.') print('\nüìã NEXT STEPS FOR FURTHER RESEARCH:') print('1. üîç Follow up on high-relevance links from search results') print('2. üîç Cross-reference multiple genealogy databases') print('3. üîç Search New Jersey newspaper archives directly') print('4. üîç Contact Essex County historical societies') print('5. üîç Check New Jersey State Archives death certificate index') print('\n=== JAMES SMITH JR. DEATH DATE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
